language.name: English
language.string: COD Item Payment
COMPLETE
DESCRIPTION
Invaders
Such is the fate of all traitors.
We may be strangers now, but if we work together, we will reach a mutually beneficial agreement.
The workers are constructing the bridges as we speak. Rest, for we will soon reach Thermopylae.
The path to Delphi is clear. Charge!
Testing Unit Museum (CHEAT)
Bella, Come Home

I will be a shell of a man until my sweet, sweet Bella is returned home. \n \nShe strays from time to time, but I think now she may be lost. I can send a couple of Scouts and a Priest with you. Please find my girl Bella. She is very gentle, and I worry about her out in the world alone. Just get her back to the yard. Don't hurt her!
Great work. Now go away.
Good Ol' Peepaw
I am so relieved, thank you! And he doesn't even look much worse than usual.
Gold on the Nile
First Steps
The Proud Few
Travelers and Traders
Do the Badari Bash!
Badari Beat-Down
The Final Badari-Down!
Camels in the Mist
Nubia Awaits!
Good work! Our military might grows by leaps and bounds.
Most impressive! You have earned your reward.
To the Bottom
Hiding Among the Islands
Flush Them Out
To the Open Desert
Push to the Pass
Giants Fell One by One
Excellent work! With every raid, the Badari can field fewer and fewer troops.
War Leaders Down!
Good work retaking the crossing.
The Golden Punch Bowl
We Three Priests
The Great Divide
Ah, there's nothing like fighting over a big ditch.
Echo Canyon Slaughter
With the Nubian army in shambles, what remains is ours for the taking.
Ace in the Hole
Gold One Way
Expedition to Libya
It's been a long journey. Here we are at last!
I'm so very happy!
I am so very, very happy!
I am so very, very, very happy!
I am so very, very, very, very happy!
I am so very, very, very, very, very happy!
I am so very, very, very, very, very, very happy!
They Shall Not Pass!
Mountain Warfare
Hold Out
Payment Required in Advance
The Medjay are a dependable tribe. Our investment will not be wasted.
Operation Napata
The Medjay have proven themselves today, as have you.
Raiding Time
Look at them run! I am quite satisfied.
Wait for It
Fall of Nubia
Emissary to Argos
Repairing Under Fire
Now that we have taken Napata, the Medjay will stay to oversee its reconstruction and protection. \n \nYou will control my Medjay forces and will have access to my units and buildings.
Well done! The Medjay are an interesting people, are they not?
Rescue Rangers
Yes, the Medjay prove their worth daily.
Hard-Won Gold
The Medjay will assist you while you set up mining operations near Napata. \n \nExpect resistance from the Nubians; this will not be a cakewalk.
The Fishin' Hole
Fish for dinner!
Wanted: Thieves
Wanted: Razings
Wanted: Predators
Grisly work, but my workers will be safer tomorrow.
Wanted: Ivory
Wanted: Nubian War Totems
Grisly work, but the Nubians will learn to bow to us.
Not to Be Trifled With
Guard Duty
Beefing Up
The Road Home
The Supporting Cast
Vizier's Doom
First to Find
Sailing Free and Far
Those pirates will trouble us no more.
It's a Free-for-All
Excellent. Now that we've killed everyone, the area will be far more peaceful.
Gettin' More ZZZs
The Zombie Prince
What an Egomaniac
It's a start.
Big King, Big Ego
That's one, but I hear there are more.
Baby Steps Back to the Throne
The Bandit Armada
The Port Master's Children
Ye have done it! Little Hesiod and Elpis are with me again.

In my humble opinion, the only way for us to get good at razing villages and cities is to raze more villages and cities. I figured we'd just attack a few, but the king got upset the last time I did that. 
 
So, I recreated a small village fortress not too far from here. Let's test your razing skills. 
 
Tear down that city as fast as you can.
It's fun to break things, isn't it?
Since you seem to like tearing stuff down, let's see if you can do it a little faster. Interested?
Impressive!
So you fancy yourself a demolition man, huh? Well, this next test should prove much harder.
Now that's how you bring down the house.
I don't think this one's possible. There's no way you'll raze the village that quickly. Not without a bomb, anyway.
I hope the civilizations you fight have strong buildings.
Mycenaean Outer Defenses
Honor the Gods
Truly our people are blessed! Now we can spread word of the gods throughout the land.
Defend Mycenae!
Victory! The palace still stands!
Draw Them Out
Gold for the Gods
A Friendly Little Loan
Excellent. What could go wrong with high-risk variable-interest home loans?
Last-Minute Cleanup
Well done. Controlling that coastline gives us early warning of invasion by sea.
A Few Good Men
Restore the Treasury
Excellent. The city's coffers are full once more.
Preaching to the Masses
Excellent! More converts are always welcome!
Spread the Word
This is a glorious day! Our people are truly blessed by the gods!
Reclaiming the Throne
The Harvest
Back to You Tenfold
May the gods bring nothing but good fortune to you, friend.
Give to the Needy
Thank you, friend! Mycenae is fortunate to have such good neighbors.
Visit King Agamemnon
Show Our Power
Protect Our People
Wanted: Boar Tusks

Wild boar can be found throughout Greece almost anywhere you go. Not only are they good for food, but also Mycenaean crafters can sometimes use their tusks. \n \nKill these beasts and bring proof to King Agamemnon to receive your rewards.
I hope this quest was not a boar for you.
Treasures can be found throughout the world, often guarded by unscrupulous criminals. \n \nKeep whatever treasures that are found. Just bring back proof of killing 50 guardians to the docks.
Good start, but there are always more criminals to be found.
Wanted: The Vill Killers
Dangerous predators found throughout Mycenae are a constant hazard to our people. \n \nKill these beasts and bring proof to King Agamemnon to receive your rewards.
Is It Any Wonder!

The Sea People encroach ever closer to my people. Our only hope is to flee across the sea. We seek master sailors to build a fleet for us.\n \nCan you help? You must complete the fleet before the Sea People find us and slaughter everyone.
The fleet is ready just in time. We will set out for new lands on the morning tide. Thank you.

Thanks to you, the fleet stands ready to sail, but we need a leader for their voyage. \n \nYou've helped so much already, but the lives of many are still at risk. Can you help guide my people to a new land to call their own? You will be rewarded.
A new land has been claimed. Now we must try to keep it.

The Sea People are like vermin. They appear to be infinite in number, and they attack everywhere. 
 
At present, they encroach ever closer to my cousin's people. As was once our lot, their only hope is to flee. 
 
As we once did, they now seek master sailors to build a fleet for them. I kind of told them about what you did for us. I hope you don't mind...
Good! The fleet is ready just in time.
The fleet you built for my cousin's people is ready to sail. As we once did, they now need a leader for their voyage. \n \nI might have told them that you handled this for us...
A new land has been claimed! Thank you.

I have a funny story for you. So, strangely enough, I have more than one cousin. And, believe it or not, this other cousin's people are also under attack by the Sea People. 
 
Their only hope is to flee across the sea. They need a fleet to do this. 
 
You know what I'm going to ask, right?
Thanks. They're going to sail with the morning tide, just like the last batch of cousins.
Yeah, so, that fleet is all ready. You did really great work. Again. \n \nAny chance you might lead their voyage? They won't leave until they have someone capable in charge.
I have high hopes for this cousin's people. I think they're going to make it.
Live Together, Die Together

Conflict always attracts opportunists. 
 
As if there weren't enough to deal with already, a column of reinforcements has been ambushed and wiped out. The few survivors say they were attacked by Greeks. I suspect a rogue general is attempting to carve off some territory for himself. 
 
Can you travel to the region where my men were ambushed and look for these vultures? They were numerous and powerful. You will need someone to help you.
You took care of the mercenaries, but it's worse than I expected. That was only their scouting force. Their actual army will not be far behind.
Best Friends Forever

I thought a direct attack might end the threat of the mercenaries quickly, but it seems all I've accomplished is to attract more attention. 
 
A new force marched into the area, under a banner that marks them as troops of Clearchus. If the man commanding them is in fact a captain in the service of Clearchus, then he is a very capable officer with troops that include many Spartans. 
 
He cannot be allowed to get a foothold here.
Outstanding work. Perhaps they will get the message now.
I'm Nothing Without You

Well. Perhaps I should not have been so hasty. 
 
You routed the scouts. And then dealt with the captain Clearchus sent in response. But that has not caused the mercenaries to waver. 
 
In fact, Clearchus seems more interested in us now. An entire army of his, under the command of his archon, has been diverted toward us. I don't need to tell you how dangerous that is.
Ha! Clearchus cannot ignore the message you've sent. There are easier targets out there. He will aim for them.
We're Like Peas and Carrots

Oh, my. 
 
Your defeat of his archon certainly earned the attention of Clearchus. He has sent his second in command, the polemarch who leads half of his entire mercenary force, to seek you out. 
 
You should probably kill him. And all his men. Before they get anywhere near here.
Amazing. Certainly, Clearchus cannot keep wasting the lives of his men like this, can he?
You Complete Me
Well, the good news is, if you survive this, there cannot be another, larger attack. \n \nThe bad news is, Clearchus himself is about. And he has all his remaining troops with him.
You and your friend are amazing commanders. The legendary Clearchus has been defeated!
Cleaning Out the Filth
Thanks to you, my people are safe. I, however, am not concerned with "safe" for myself. I am interested in vengeance. \n \nWill you help me deliver what they deserve?
We have finally started to make these lands safe. Thank you.
Rescue Mission
My people have sent word. They need help securing their new home. \n \nCould you go to their aid and keep the Sea People from destroying this place too?
Now my people are safe. They can rest knowing that their homeland has been cleansed.
We Killed These Guys Already!

It would appear that some Followers of Autolycus survived their earlier encounters with you, because they are harassing cities throughout the country once again. \n \nThese weeds should be pulled before they have a chance to spread. Surely they are now only a fraction as powerful as they once were, but... in time...
I seem to have underestimated the strength of the Followers of Autolycus. They appear stronger than they ever were before. Still, a job well done, and you took some wind out of their sails.
Why Does It Have to Be Bandits?

It is clear now that we did not happen onto the Followers of Autolycus while they were regrouping. They had already regrouped, and these attacks are part of a coordinated plan. \n \nUntil we clear out most of the villages belonging to the Followers of Autolycus, we will not be able to travel safely from city to city in this area.
A job well done.
Left with No Choice
We have no choice but to hunt the Followers of Autolycus down and eradicate them all. If we leave any alive, they'll only return later. \n \nFind them. All of them.
Excellent. I'm sure that is the last we'll see of them.
Celebrate Hekatombia

We really like to sacrifice cows here in Argos, but someone has been stealing them. \n \nWe need to get our cattle back so our priests can slaughter them. Can you help? The king will be very pleased if you do.
Wonderful! Our priests will be thrilled!
Find the Pharaoh's Favorite
Oh, thank Ra! He must never know I lost her.
Find Pharaoh's Luggage

Oh, thank Ra! He must never know I lost all his stuff. Hope those Sea People didn't stink it up too much! \n \nThere's definitely more luggage to find out there. I'll reward you for every bit you find!
Kill the Chieftain!
Kill More Chieftains!
Sink the Command Ship

The Sea People are commanding their fleet from a single huge vessel. We must find that boat and sink it. Only then can we hope to push the Sea People from our lands! \n \nIf we spot any enemy camps while we're out there, we should destroy those as well.
Ha! Without that ship, the Sea People's navy will be in total disarray!
Stop the Sea People

It's time to go on the offensive. Our scouts report nearby islands are crawling with Sea People. They must be staging attacks from these places. Find them and kill them before they have a chance to set foot in Argos. \n \nBe on the lookout for their navy too. There are rumors of a giant ship among their fleet.
The Sea People are learning to fear the power of Argos, but I'm afraid this fight isn't over. With your help, we can push them away from our lands forever.
Do Something Cool for Me
Egyptian Alliance

You have cast the armies of the Sea People into disarray. Although they can no longer threaten us with organized attacks, their scattered troops attack whatever they happen to be near, looking for food and treasure. 
 
Scouts report one of these rogue elements headed toward Argos. If we act quickly, we can catch these troops in the mountain passes and ambush them! 
 
Get out there and prepare an ambush to defeat them.
Was ambushing those Sea People fun? I hope so!
Lots of Rogues!
Cataclysm
Now that their navy is out of the way, it's time to finish the Sea People. Their island stronghold is their final foothold in our land. End this war. Now.
Good work! I doubt we'll see the Sea People in those numbers again any time soon. You have the thanks of the people of Argos, and our eternal friendship!
Losing Your Religion
All-Out War!

It is clear that the Sea People will just keep coming. Through my keen understanding of history and strategy, I've concluded that the only hope we have is to kill every last one of them. \n \nAttack one of the islands that they inhabit and conquer it. It doesn't matter which island as long as there are Sea People there. We will just have to clear them out one island at a time.
That's one! Keep up the good work.
Get Our Houses Back
Finally! Maybe we can get some peace around here.
It Burns Us
Run the Blockade
Excellent! The Sea People's navy is crippled! All that's left is to finish them once and for all!
Dock Rats!
Harass the Sea People

The Sea People are tenacious. We need to keep the pressure on, or they'll regroup for a counterattack.
 
Our scouts report the nearby islands are still crawling with Sea People soldiers. Find them and reduce their numbers. 
 
Be on the lookout for their navy. Rumors say they have many powerful ships.
Excellent! They're learning to fear us. With your help, I believe we can push the Sea People away from our lands forever.
Retake the Islands
We Can Always Use More

It's silly to haul these resources back one at a time. Go out and load up everything, I'll make sure it gets back to Argos.
 
You'll run into resistance, so build strong defenses or an army. 
 
The enemy is on to us now and has attacked the ships I use to transport what you've gathered. Those ships won't be able to wait forever, so you will need to gather all the resources quickly.
Loadin' Up on Carbs
Putting on a Few Pounds
No one will miss a meal with you helping out.
Hard as a Rock
Stones for My Castle
It's my dream to have a large castle built in Argos. Collect a bunch of Stone, and I'll make sure it gets back.\n \nYou'll run into resistance so don't forget to keep defenses up or an army on hand.
Ah, now my dreams will come true.
Kill Some Trees for the Cause
It's all here! Nice work.
Grab Some Lumber, Take Some Cuts
We can never get enough wood around here. Gather us some more, and I'll make sure it gets back to Argos.\n \nYou'll run into resistance, so don't forget to keep defenses up or an army on hand.
Trade for Mosaic Tile
Breaking Eggs to Make an Omelet
You're great at defending things. Thank you, my friend.
Food Equals Villagers
Our First Enemy
Wood Equals Buildings
Bright Lights, Big City
Eliminating a Threat
Not only do you have green thumbs, but fast thumbs too.
WOW! Just WOW! If I had a hat it would be off.
That was amazing.
Ha! They said it was impossible. Excellent work.
Kill the Docks
Excellent! That should slow them down.
Mow 'Em Down!
Helping Out a Neighbor
The Bandit Leaders
We Found Them
Fishing Our Waters
Yar! No fish for those scurvy worms.
Advisor Protection
Keep Them Under Our Wing
Unbelievable! Sicyon's Advisor Hall still remains intact.
Get the Goods
A Show of Support
Here They Come!

Troy was defeated, but you might not know it to look at how the remaining Trojans behave. They have some "issues" with authority. \n \nIf we're going to control them, we're going to have show them we mean business. Assemble a large enough force to be intimidating.
Nice work! Seeing all those troops sitting there should keep the Trojans in line.
Some of the Trojans have gotten the message, but there are still those who think they can oppose us. If we show them an even larger force, they should quiet down.
Nice work! All these troops should keep these Trojans in line.

Only the dimmest of Trojans think they can oppose our rule now, but these dullards still try to convince their fellows to rebel. \n \nLet's push the limits and build the largest force imaginable. A force no sane person could suggest opposing.
Wow! Getting an army of that size together that quickly makes it clear standing up to us will be futile.
Returning Home

The work your armies performed at Troy ensured Helen's safe return. My soldiers, as well as those of King Odysseus, will be returning home to their families after our victory. \n \nReturn to your homeland and tell your people of your great accomplishments. I will send great rewards with you.
It is good to see the safe return of your great army.
Helen Has Been Taken!
Good work! At Troy, you will stand by my side and enjoy the fruits of victory.
Secure a Foothold
Never Let Them See You Coming
The Trojans think we've left! This is exactly what we wanted!
Hector Must Fall
I Need a Hero
I Have a Cunning Plan

If Agamemnon's all-out assault goes as well as I think it will, we'll need to find another way through the gates of Troy. I have an idea that might get us in, but I'll need Pine Planks and Animal Hides first.
Excellent! Now let's hope I can convince Agamemnon to try my way before he gets us all killed.
Keeping Control
Nice work! With the world afraid of seeing you step onto the battlefield, I can rebuild Troy... my way.
Rallying at the Temples
Take the Beach!
Good work! Now that we have some breathing room, we'll secure our foothold.
Horsing Around
The King of Ithaca
It is good to see you again, my friend.
Hold the Fort!
I knew we could count on you. Now let's make the Trojans pay for their crimes.
New Troy Needs Assistance!
Finally, some assistance. How soon can your men be ready to go?
COMPLETION
For testing purposes only.
For testing purposes only.
PROGRESS
Gather your courage! We must cross the pass.
Get off my lawn!
Ol' Man Fischer wants his dog Bella returned to the yard.
Don't tell Peepaw, but I prefer the Egyptian syrup. It has the butter mixed right in, you know...
Where is that army I requested? I am not a patient man!
Where is that temple and army? I am not a patient man!
Where is that temple and army I requested? I am not a patient man!
A good Badari village is a smashed Badari village.
We must control that area to succeed.
This is the key to taking Lower Nubia. Move quickly.
Libya awaits!
Meet Prince Sesostris in Libya.
Don't be late! I wish to continue being the Camel Gauntlet champion.
Three too hard for you, huh?
They say five cannot be done...
I understand how the challenge here may be too much for you...
You've come this far? Now you're going to quit?
Camels cannot do such things. Their legs will come off.
You are not going to destroy anything just sitting around here.
Build fortifications to prevent the Nubian army from passing.
The Medjay will not work for us until we have paid them.
Work with the Medjay to conquer Napata.
The Medjay will not last long. We must support them.
One last push is all we need. What are you waiting for?
The coastal villages won't survive without your help. Hurry!
What are you waiting for? Get out there and direct the Medjay.
Defend Napata.
The Egyptian forces need to be freed.
Get a move on, or that area will be fished out.
Have you killed those criminals yet?
My workers are still in danger.
Follow Prince Sesostris back to Egypt.
The sea lanes must be cleared.
If you do not act now, we will lose the islands.
Have ye destroyed their navy?
Let's go. You'll never get better at tearing down people's homes just sitting here.
Tear down the test city as quickly as you can.
Those buildings won't fall down by themselves.
Not enough time, Demolition Man!
I told you... not without a bomb.
Mycenae is in danger! To arms!
Let's hope tonight's raid goes well.
Leave the charity work to the priestesses. Mogoadius got bills to pay.
I fear for my advisors. Please rescue them as soon as you can.
Please, go help our gold miners.
How goes your mission?
Return when you have completed your task.
Why do you delay? There are people starving!
There is no time to waste.
Argos awaits!
Mycenae awaits!
Protect those villages. Thyestes' soldiers are looking for revenge.
Ah! These can always be put to use.
My people will surely perish if we cannot flee.
My people must sail soon. I beg you to lead them.
My cousin's people will surely perish if we cannot flee this land.
My cousin's people must sail soon. I beg you to lead them.
I've got a lot of cousins, and they all have their own people who need fleets.
You should see family dinners at our house. We need a really big table.
The mercenaries must be stopped. If they aren't, we'll soon have every man with a spear running about and trying to take a piece.
If Clearchus gets the idea that this area is easy pickings, we'll have mercenaries stabbing us by dinner.
Clearchus has a lot of mean, angry, heavily armed troops...
Clearchus certainly has a lot of troops, doesn't he?
Who would have thought that chasing off a few scouts would lead to Clearchus rampaging about with a giant mercenary army? Not I, I assure you...
Our land is still threatened by invaders.
My people need your help to secure their new homeland.
The longer we take, the stronger the bandits get.
Our safety depends on you.
It is the only way.
Find any of those cows yet?
Have you found that camel yet? Find her soon, or she might turn into Sea People lunch!
That ship must be destroyed!
Strike back at the Sea People. Quickly.
Attack and defeat the Sea People's armies in the coastal islands.
I'd really like to keep my head. Go smash those Sea People for me.
Make sure you hide all the bodies from the previous ambushes. When I'm walking through a pass in the mountains and I come across hundreds of corpses, I sometimes consider turning around.
Time to hit the Sea People where they live!
Defeat the Sea People.
By the gods, what is taking you so long?
Keep the pressure on those Sea People.
The Sea People navy is still a threat!
Those Sea People are still out there.
Attack and defeat the Sea People in the coastal islands.
My ships are ready to haul back all that you gather.
I understand if you're not able to hold out this long.
Why the delay? We must have delicious broccoli!
Why the delay? The people yearn for more broccoli.
Two words: More. Broccoli.
Where are the Farms? What are you going to tell the children when they ask where their broccoli is?
What are ye waiting for? Let's get the Followers of Autolycus out of my ocean.
Some of the locals are getting a bit restless. Let's put them in their place.
Build a large force.
If you let them think they can make the rules, we'll be in real trouble.
Build a large force.
Can a force this large be built so quickly? And if it can, how will we pay them? I'll worry about that later...
Build the largest force possible.
Time to go home.
Where are those Pine Planks?
Troy still controls areas along the coast. Clear them out and set up forward positions there.
Have you escorted the camps to the coast yet?
Hector must die!
Oh, I've got a plan, all right.
Have you taken care of my elite problem yet?
While out questing in the world, find and kill any elite troops you see.
Our moment of triumph is here!
What is it?
King Agamemnon needs you to hold off the Trojans.
Offer to help New Troy.
Are you going to help us? If you don't, perhaps I should be curious about your reasons for being here...
SUMMARY

Look, I'll level with you. I'm getting pretty tired of these mercenaries, though I admire their persistence. I'm guessing they're getting pretty tired of being smacked-down because they've amassed the biggest horde I've ever seen, and it's headed right for Crete.
 
Our Scouts have reported 40 armies in the area, and they're the most ill-mannered, surly, depraved, vicious, and savage group of Lelegan Mercenaries in existence.
 
You know the drill: We can't hold them off for much longer, time is running out, etcetera. Bring a friend.
Amazing! I thought they had you toward the end, but you pulled it out. They won't be back for - I don't know - at least a week.
Those mercenaries won't defeat themselves.
Defend the Wonder from 40 waves of the most ill-mannered, surly, depraved, vicious, and savage Lelegan Mercenaries in existence.
Cretins on the Coast!
Mercenaries at the Mount!

Blessed Zeus, you've finally arrived!
 
A nearby outpost has come under attack from a group of raiding Clubmen.
 
As your Village Elder, I advise you to defend the outpost and show the citizens of Greece that they are safe to settle new lands.
The hero returns! The people will not forget that you came to their rescue.
Eliminate all of the Clubmen attacking the outpost.
Full bellies and a swelling population, eh? Excellent work. You're well on your way to earning the trust and respect of the people.
I remember this time! Wait, did I tell you about testing the new Storehouse building?

The word on the street is that the people are ready to fight for you, but they will need proper equipment to do so.\n \nHere is a blueprint for a Gear Hall. Once placed in your Capital City, it can be used to outfit your armies with weapons and armor.
Be sure to check for gear in the stores you encounter while visiting other regions and players.
Let me see if I can find the right blueprint... actually, didn't I already give you the Gear Hall blueprint? Is it in your inventory?
Use the blueprint in your inventory to construct a Gear Hall in your Capital City.
Your victory here sends a clear message to those who think the people are easy prey. After all, they're your people now.
You must take the fight to those who attack your people.
Build a Barracks to produce an army of Spearmen, and use them to destroy all of the buildings belonging to the Followers of Autolycus.
You are a wise leader! The citizens look forward to future displays of our technological prowess.
Good job. They will think twice before attacking us again.
If we don't fight back, they won't stop.
Eliminate all the Badari attacking the outpost.
Eliminate all the Barbarians attacking the outpost.

Challenge: But Can You Do It Faster?

Challenge: Quell the Masses Again!
Challenge: Finally Quell the Masses!

Helping Agamemnon
I once caught a fish this big. How about you?
Whew! That bought us precious time. I hope the Scouts return soon with all the information we need to counterattack.

We kicked the hornet's nest! The Followers of Autolycus are on their way to our new colonies, hoping to reclaim their old territory. \n \nDefend the Town Center! I will send the village Scouts to find their bases while they are occupied battling you.
Defend the Town Center from the Followers of Autolycus.
Please save our colony from the Followers of Autolycus!
It seems safe, for now. They'll come back. They always come back.

I received a letter from a small village on the outskirts of Sicyon. 
 
King Thyestes of Mycenae has sent his armies against them, and the villagers can barely protect themselves. We must defend them and push the Mycenaean army out. 
 
Go there and help conquer the area. Success will help develop our relationship with Sicyon.
Sicyon will not forget the help we provided.
Have you helped our future friends yet?

Sicyon is in the middle of a real mess. Mycenae is raiding their villages, and the Followers of Autolycus fled us to take root in their lands. 
 
Far outside Sicyon proper is their Advisor Hall, unguarded. The Followers of Autolycus are on their way to plunder it.
 
We cannot get an army there in time, but you can lead the villagers in mounting a defense with whatever they have on hand.
Unbelievable! Sicyon's Advisor Hall survives. They are very grateful.
The Advisor Hall is right in the path of those barbarians!

While you were defending the Advisor Hall, we received an honored guest: Agamemnon of Mycenae. King Thyestes is his uncle, but the previous king was Agamemnon's father, Atreus. After hearing of our successes against the Mycenaean army at Sicyon, he left Sparta to seek our aid. \n \nSpeak with Agamemnon, and let us place the proper king on the throne.
My cousin slew my father, and now my uncle uses what is rightfully my title to wage pointless wars. Help me end it!
Greetings, friend. Do you agree that my cause is righteous?
Speak with Agamemnon.

Congratulations, your strong and steady leadership has led us into a glorious new Age! Now we can unlock technologies that were once beyond our reach.\n \nAs your Village Elder, I advise you to select a variety of technologies of your choosing. With these new advancements, you will be able to efficiently expand your empire.

Oh, this isn't good.
 
I have learned the identity of the group behind the attacks on outposts in this region, and as I feared, it is the Followers of Autolycus. Cowards, all of them, preying only upon the weak!
 
Now is the time to strike back, to show the people that you are the great leader they need and to guarantee a bright future for your empire. You must prepare an army and drive these cretins from our lands!
Battle Between Friends
Crafter's Calling
Use the blueprint in your Inventory to construct a Crafting Hall in your Capital City.
Use the blueprint in your inventory to construct an Arena in your Capital City.
Elpis Returned
Hesiod Returned
Don't let his troops see you until it's too late.
A rolling cart gathers no moss!
Destroy the base belonging to the Followers of Autolycus.
Those Hetairoi know how to walk softly and carry a big stick. Except they're on horses. And the stick is on fire.
Defend the outer village of Sicyon by defeating Thyestes' armies.
I could never have done this without you, friend. It will take time to repair all that Thyestes has broken during his rule. Visit me again after I have assumed full control.
There is no time for doubt. Thyestes' end is so close.
Destroy King Thyestes' Fortress, and then kill King Thyestes.
Do you hear that? It is the sound of victory!

Terrible news! Our scouts found a giant camp belonging to the Followers of Autolycus. 
 
Every building must burn, or else they will just rebuild the camp. 
 
Advising Commander Jason from the city of Helice has sent his best Hetairoi to aid us.
Barracks Destroyed
Stables Destroyed

Man cannot live forever on whatever equipment they might find guarded by complete strangers. We have many skilled craftsmen who merely need a place to hone their craft. \n \nThis is a blueprint for a Crafting Hall. From here, you can select the Crafting Schools our people should focus on.
I once made a fish out of wood. It didn't taste very good.
What a beautiful hall! Surely we are the envy of our neighbors.
Advisors are awfully picky about where they want to live.

The neighboring city of Sicyon is between a rock and a hard place. Thyestes of Mycenae is mobilizing his armies against them, and the villagers outside Sicyon are asking if we can shelter them until their lands are peaceful again. Unfortunately, the Followers of Autolycus fled towards Sicyon, so they are directly in the path between the refugees and safety! \n \nWe have a small outpost we can use as a refugee camp. Help the villagers make it to the camp by defeating the Followers of Autolycus!
Our allies are safe in our lands for now. I can only hope Sicyon itself remains standing.
The refugees have no hope of making it past the Followers of Autolycus on their own.
Protect Sicyon's Advisor Hall.
I'd Like an Advisor with That Hall
Homer Run
Clitus Attacks
Draco's Legion
It has been many years since I last saw Mycenae. There are stories I could tell you. This one time, I was walking down its streets. No wait, I shouldn't tell that story. Never mind.
Protect Sicyon's Advisor Hall.
The Advisor Hall still stands, but not for long.

The Followers of Autolycus are determined to take down Sicyon's Advisor Hall. We may need to help Sicyon defend it forever, as far as I know. \n \nAgain, we cannot get an army there in time, so protect that building with Guard Towers and whatever else you have before the Followers descend on it.

We have found where the Followers of Autolycus have been coming ashore. Except now they are sailing back to the north so they can regroup and attack in larger numbers. If we take out all their Docks in this area, it will strand a lot of them here so we can deal with them in smaller numbers.

Agamemnon has successfully assumed the throne in Mycenae. He sent a messenger asking for your presence. \n \nI am sure the city needs help after Thyestes' rule, and any help we can give to our friend will be appreciated.
The Village Elder would like you to talk to King Agamemnon in Mycenae.
Ah, the champion of Mycenae graces us! Have you come to help rebuild?

Now that the cowards who followed King Thyestes are on the run, our outlying villages are in danger. \n \nThere's not much time, but we need to get defenders out to the villages until Thyestes's retreating rabble have gone. Do not let these fleeing villains pillage any of the outlying villages.
Good work! Now our enemies will think twice before launching an attack.
Build Fortresses in the specified locations.
Protect the allied Town Centers from King Thyestes' loyalists.

The underhanded Trojans have taken my brother's faithful wife, Helen. For that, they will pay. I have called together the largest army of Greeks the world has ever seen. Their boots will walk atop the rubble of Troy. 
 
I assume you, of course, wish to have your name prominent among those who form this historic force? 
 
Good. We need a mighty fleet to carry this army across the Aegean. Bring me 100 Pine Planks so we may build ships and set sail for Troy.

The invasion is set. Thanks to your efforts, our armies are loaded and the fleet is ready to sail. \n \nOnce we reach the shores of Troy, your soldiers are to secure the beaches defended by a powerful Fortress. Clear the outer defenses of Troy by destroying this Fortress.
Storm the beach and destroy the Trojan Fortress to weaken Troy's first line of defense.
Secure Troy's beach by destroying the Fortress.
Docks Destroyed

Our forces have solidified their foothold on the beaches of Troy, and King Odysseus has made camp there. Odysseus is a wise man. If we are to rescue fair Helen, we must travel to the beach camp at Troy and seek his counsel. \n \nLet us travel there and help him bring victory to Greece!
King Agamemnon would like you to travel to the Troy Beach Camp and and talk to Odysseus.

The beaches are under our control, but only because the Trojans do not realize how easily we could be thrown back into the sea. 
 
Before they get wise, I need your soldiers to construct defensible positions for our forces. Clear out the last of Troy's forward defenses and construct Town Centers in their former locations. 
 
After that, we are here to stay.
Excellent work. Not only have we solidified our defense, we can now mount attacks from the locations you secured.
Clear out Troy's defenses and build Town Centers in the marked locations.

The Trojan opposition has demoralized some of the troops. I guess most were expecting that we would appear in great numbers and frighten them into returning Helen without bloodshed. 
 
If our fragile alliance starts to fracture, we'll have a hard time keeping enough troops in place to get the job done. We need to parade some Heroes before the soldiers. That should give them a shot of courage. 
 
Find three Heroes and tell them to return to me.
I can already see the change in attitude at the camp. I am certain we will make short work of Troy.
Where are our Heroes?

Keep what I am about to say to yourself. I've been looking at Troy's army and defenses, and I am now certain that she is too difficult for our force. Hector leads the Trojan forces with great skill, and his presence emboldens his men.
 
Achilles has volunteered to track down and deal with Hector and his elite guard. If Hector can be slain, then all of Troy will be shattered. 
 
Since this mission cannot afford to fail, we need you. With help from Achilles, track down and kill Hector.
Join Achilles to kill Hector and his elite guards.
We will give Troy a few days to mourn the loss of Hector. After that, they will mourn the loss of Troy itself.

The Trojans are weak enough, but their walls are not. We will have to use our wits. 
 
Never fear, I have a plan. First, we convince the Trojans that we are leaving. 
 
Take a small force and escort our packed-up camps back to the coast.

The time has come for our final gambit. The Trojans believe we have given up, and our men have spent the past three days constructing a giant wooden horse, a symbol of Troy. I have constructed a ruse that will trick the Trojans into accepting the horse into their city as a gift. Little do they know that this horse holds our greatest warriors. \n \nOnce night falls, order the men to leave the Trojan Horse and destroy the Gate House. This will allow Achilles to enter with his men. Lead Achilles to the Troy Palace, and we will have rescued Helen.
Use the soldiers in the Trojan Horse to destroy the Gate House, then escort Achilles to the Troy Palace.

Victory at last! We can finally head home to our families. \n \nWe owe a great debt to you and your people. We can never repay you for all you've done, but please take these treasures from our campaign.
Talk to the Magistrate in New Troy.

I received a message from King Agamemnon. Most of the battle in Troy is done, but there is a lot of rebuilding. Since he was so impressed by your help in Mycenae, he wants you to go to New Troy and help the Magistrate there.
Defend Mycenae from the invaders.
**Testing Unit Museum (CHEAT)**
**<Obsolete Quest>**
Reinforcements Arrive in...
Hold for Reinforcements
Locate and gather Food. Use the Food to train Villagers from the Town Center.
That Food won't gather itself.

With the outpost saved, the people need to be shown how to fend for themselves. As the saying goes, give the fish a man and the fish will be fed... hmm, that doesn't sound quite right.\n \nI remember now! Return to the outpost and get the people familiar with the many ways they can gather Food, and then train more Villagers from the Town Center.

A great man once said that technology is first learned, and then applied. Wait, I said that, just then. Am I a great man?\n \nAnyway, this is the ideal time to test out your new Storehouses. Return to the outpost and build a Storehouse near the forest so you can easily gather Wood. Use the Wood to build Houses, which will allow you to increase the outpost's population.
Use the blueprint in your Inventory to construct an Advisor Hall in your Capital City.
Bring Pine Planks to King Agamemnon.
King Agamemnon would like you to find and bring some Heroes to your Town Center.
Odysseus would like you to gather some Pine Planks and Animal Hides for something.
Return to the Village Elder in your Capital City.
Tribute Gold to the nearby friendly villages.
Tribute more resources to the surrounding friendly villages.
While on your travels, convert more Villagers with your Priests.
Kill 25 Boar.
Find treasures and kill the Guardians.
Kill 25 Wolves.
We need those Watch Posts repaired.
The Mycenaean Engineer wants you to repair some of his Watch Posts.
King Agamemnon would like you to rescue Agathon and General Heron by bringing them to your Town Center.
Find another Wonder and tear it to the ground.

King Thyestes didn't just have one Wonder dedicated to himself. He had many. He must have had everyone in the city working on the blasted things. \n \nWe could be tearing these Wonders down forever, but nobody wants to be reminded of the old fool.
There are still some troublemakers in this region. Have you destroyed the Temples yet?
Ah, excellent work. Now that we've destroyed their Temples, I'm sure these people will be easier to keep in line.

Paris escaped the city during our attack and is causing all manner of trouble. Among other things, he is now trying to rally the locals in the countryside to fight back against my control. \n \nThey seem to be rallying at their Temples, so let's take those down and give them a little less to believe in.
King Agamemnon wants you to destroy King Thyestes' Wonder.
Tear that Wonder down!

During the brief time he was king, Thyestes apparently had a Wonder dedicated to himself. Knowing how well-liked he was, he also had a stout Fortress built to guard it. 
 
Ha! What an attention wench. 
 
Find that Wonder and tear it down. I want nothing built by King Thyestes left standing.
Travel to the sacred mountain and build a Temple atop it.
Please let me know as soon as the Temple is complete.
Build Storehouses and Farms.
Travel to the nearby villages and convert Villagers with your Priests.
Have you finished converting the Villagers yet? Where did I put those pamphlets...?

Some of the outlying villages still live in ignorance, unaware of the gods. We must convert them, though we should expect some to cling to the old ways. \n \nTravel forth and convert at least 12 Villagers.
Gather some Gold and build Temples where the enemy villages once stood.
Who doesn't like gold, really? I know I do.
You have done all the gods have asked and more. I'm sure they appreciate their enormous pile of gold.

The gods require more of us. Certain villages in the surrounding lands still question the Oracle's wisdom. 
 
Go forth, raze these villages, and then build Temples on the land where the villages once stood. 
 
Oh, and while you're out there... the Oracle would like you to gather a little Gold as well.
The High Priestess would like you to build a Wonder on the highest peak.
Is the Wonder finished yet? Why not?
I am told the Wonder can be seen from miles around.

Now that we have the means to construct a tremendous structure, we should travel to one of the highest peaks and build it in honor of the gods. This will show that we are a grateful civilization entitled to all the riches we receive. \n \nI have already sent Priests to consecrate the land where the structure will go.
Enemy Arrives in...
Now that's impressive! You can really lay down the Farms.
We need those Farms. The broccoli supplies are low.
Where are the Farms? Don't stop now! Imagine it, broccoli as far as the eye can see!
Battering Rams Destroyed
Gear Hall Built in Capital City
Advisor Hall Built in Capital City
Arena Built in Capital City
Crafting Hall Built in Capital City

Homer routinely leaves his lair to extort money from nearby villages. Two such villages are near Sicyon. They claim Homer is on his way, and he has set up a camp on the edge of a gully. \n \nThe villages will not help us outright, but they are willing to trade if we send Caravans. In the end, it is up to us to end Homer's reign.
First Army Arrives in...
Armies Ambushed
Agamemnon's Army
Go to the ambush location, build up an army with the provided resources, and destroy Thyestes' reinforcements.
With the Stables destroyed, we can move to the next phase.
While the Stables still stand, we cannot begin our siege.
Agamemnon wants you to hold the front line until reinforcements arrive, then destroy the enemy Stables outside Mycenae.
Your ramming skills exceed all expectations! Tomorrow's assault on Mycenae will be Thyestes' end!
Your ambush has made these misguided soldiers wonder if Thyestes is worth fighting for. We must press on!

With the Stables gone, we can build up right outside the city. While Herculos proceeds, I call upon you for a most daring task. 
 
I am sure Thyestes will send his troops to try and stop us, and we will use that against him. My scouts will lead you to a perfect spot for an ambush. Destroy Thyestes' reinforcements, and his soldiers will question fighting for him.
 
I can't spare many troops to assist you, but I will give you plenty of resources to rapidly speed up your efforts. Use them wisely!

Herculos' men surround Mycenae, but to attack Thyestes in my own home city would be folly. We need a clever distraction... Once again, we need you.
 
Lead a raid against the farming outpost that supplies most of his army's food. Hungry men will think twice in supporting a false king.
 
Herculos will provide you with some Battering Rams. Use them to wreck the enemy buildings, but be sure to protect the rams against infantry and cavalry.
Use Battering Rams to destroy the enemy's Farms, Houses, and Stables. Be sure to defend them against infantry and cavalry.
Town Center Destroyed

Draco is known for his many lackeys. He has a fortified base on the other side of a thick forest, and he rarely leaves. \n \nThat means we will have to take the fight to him. Break through Draco's defenses, defeat him, and raze his base. Just be wary of surprise support!

Avast! The sailors aboard yer Fishing Boats have seen other sails on the horizon. Seems the lice-ridden dogs who attacked yer outpost now befoul me beautiful seas! \n \nThese Followers of Autolycus must be drinking from the bilges if they think they can fish our waters. Let's smash their Fishing Boats and set their Docks ablaze!
Destroy the Fishing Boats and Docks belonging to the Followers of Autolycus.

Would ye listen to the sad tale of an old sailor? 
 
Ye see, some time ago, the Followers of Autolycus ransacked me home, murdered me wife, set fire to me nets, stole me harpoons, boiled me cat, drank me grog, and sat in me favorite chair. They also took me children, Elpis and Hesiod, to raise among their kind. 
 
Yar. I cannot stand to think of me wee ones growing up to be such as them. Might I persuade ye to try to get me poor little ones back home?
Rescue Elpis and Hesiod from the Followers of Autolycus.
Yar. Rescue me children, Cap'n. They're all I have!
Yar. With those bandits gone, we can trade with the north.
Destroy the Triremes and Fortress of the Followers of Autolycus.
They won't be able to organize an attack again anytime soon.
Draco's fort may be tough to crack, but I believe in you.
Kill the Bandit Chieftain Draco and raze his Town Center.
What did I say? He fell for it hook, line, and sinker.
Clitus can't resist a challenge to his power.
Defend the Town Center and kill the Bandit Chieftain Clitus.
The villages of Sicyon are grateful for your help.
Homer will have no place to run to!
Age III Reached
Treasure Discovered
Age IV Reached
Help the Mycenaean Trader\n
Visit the city of Mycenae and offer to assist the Mycenaean Trader. He is willing to provide you with blueprints needed for your Capital City, if you agree to help him.
It's still the worst thing that has ever happened! Will you please rescue my family?
Help the Mycenaean Trader

Our people appreciate the work you have done, but we are missing a certain something. Decoration! Life! Beauty!
 
I wrote a Mycenaean Trader, hoping to fix this, and it turns out he is in a bit of trouble of his own. If we scratch his back, he'll scratch ours. Travel to Mycenae and offer your assistance. 
 
The reigning king of Mycenae is not the friendliest of rulers, but for now, he will give you free passage.
What a hero! Please accept these blueprints as a reward for your assistance. There are not too many good people like you around these parts anymore.

Thank goodness you made it!
 
I moved to Mycenae to make a living for my family in a small village on the coast. When I was passing through, I saw my home in flames!
 
Bandits have destroyed my home and taken my friends and family! 
 
Will you help rescue my family and rebuild the village? I don't have much, but I can at least fulfill the Village Elder's request.

Enemies Defeated
Defeat all enemies with a co-op partner.
Defeat all enemies.
Defeat the Followers of Autolycus.
Match Won
Family Members Rescued by Transport
Town Center Repaired

Help the Mycenaean Trader rebuild his village. Use your starting resources to repair the Town Center and upgrade it to Age II. Then build Farms and rescue his captured family members with your Transport.
Mycenaean Trader's Family
A successful adventure! The Storehouse is one of many technologies you will learn and use.
How are the Farms?
Advance to Age II, then build Farms before time runs out.

Now that you know the basics, why don't you put them to a test?
 
There is an outpost that could use some Farms. Farms require a more advanced town, so you will have to Age Up first. A piece of cake! That you will bake with the wheat from your Farms! That is if you can finish in time.
 
The outpost will need the Farms completed in a timely manner. Will that be a problem?
Farms are truly the third wonder of the world! I bet you will be back for more farming in no time.
Your enemies will tremble when they learn of our mighty Farms!
Advance to Age II, then quickly build Farms before time runs out.
Advance to Age II, then even more quickly build Farms before time runs out.
Advance to Age II, then as fast as you can, build Farms before time runs out.
Advance to Age II, then even faster than you ever thought possible, build Farms before time runs out.
Is it even possible? Advance to Age II, then even faster than anyone could have ever thought possible, build Farms before time runs out.

Ready to try another challenge?
 
Your people have taken note of the Farms and your quick handiwork. And of course, they want more. Let's see if we can get even more attention by making more of a spectacle. 
 
Visit another village and build Farms again, but this time do it faster.

Ah! Up for a challenge?
 
Small outposts might be able to rely on forage for food, but you're not going to feed an empire on berries. Farms are required for a steady food supply and growth. Now that we can build them, we should encourage our people to do so. 
 
Show your people the way. Build some Farms as quickly as possible in one of our outer villages.

This is getting crazy.
 
Your farming demonstrations are the talk of the empire. I can't imagine you can get much faster, but if you can, it'll only be good for us. 
 
Visit another village and show them how to build Farms even faster than the last time.
Nobody thinks it's possible to build Farms any faster than you have done thus far. Do you think you can do it?\n \nVisit one more village and build Farms even faster than before.
Give a man a fish, and ye have a very happy man!

Yar! Ye up for a bit of fishing?
 
Some nearby waters be teeming with fish. I bet ye could pull up the haul of yer life!
 
Build yer Docks and as many Fishing Boats as ye can, then go fish! But keep yer eyes peeled. Those Followers of Autolycus have been spotted in the area. Just in case, Advisor Matius from Helice will give ye a few Triremes as an escort.
And the crafting begins! Be sure to select a Crafting School.
Sicyon Refugees
