Refugees Reached Safety
Merchant Carts Returned
Merchant Carts Located

The Followers of Autolycus stole my grandson's carts! They rode the carts around and around, and now the carts are all over the place!
 
They were full of building materials for our home. If we act quickly, maybe we can recover the materials before the Followers use them for something even more terrible.
 
Whatever you can find in the carts is yours if you can recover them.
Cleitus will be overjoyed that you recovered his carts. Please put whatever was in them to good use.
Locate and recover the stolen Merchant Carts from the Followers of Autolycus.
War Lodges Destroyed
Huts Destroyed
Friendly Villagers
Your empire will soon rival that of Mycenae! And it seems you learned a thing or two about using boats to boot. That might come in handy down the road... or is that up the creek?
Enemy
The good people of Mycenae cheer once again for your great Capital City.

The outer villages are safe for now, but we need to get defenses in place to keep them that way. \n \nThere are three peaks not far outside the city walls. Travel to these and build a Fortress atop each. That should give us advance warning of any future attacks.
Are the Fortresses complete yet?
We must defend the Fortress!

They were nice enough to take their time about it, but the Trojan army is launching a counterattack against our northern flank. We must hold that position, or the entire beachhead behind us will be at risk. \n \nDefend the Fortress in the north from the Trojan onslaught, or this will get ugly for us quickly.
Stronghold Must Survive
Ally's Town Center Must Survive
Advisor Hall Must Survive
Hector Killed
Elite Guards Killed
Palace Must Survive
Travel to the surrounding friendly villages and send them resources as Tribute.

Oh, thank the gods. Other cities are beginning to help us. 
 
During King Thyestes' reign, many of the outer Mycenaean villages were forgotten. Now those people are starved for resources. 
 
Please help us. Gather resources and send those to the villages as Tribute, so the people can feed and shelter their families. There is not much time for some.

Thanks to you, the city's coffers are bulging, but many people in the outlying villages need loans to rebuild homes destroyed in the fighting.\n \nMight you head out there and send them some Gold as Tribute? They'll pay us a bit of interest down the road, of course, but nothing worth mentioning to them now.

We are still finding small outlying villages that just cannot sustain themselves. \n \nWe could still use your help. Gather resources to send them as Tribute so they can feed and shelter their families. There is not much time for some.

Your work is not yet done. Many out there have still not heard of the gods. If you manage to convert more Villagers, you will be rewarded. \n \nOnce you have converted 30 more Villagers in your travels, return and you will be rewarded with goods from the temples.

Yar. One of me sailors spun a yarn about a bandit Fortress so tall it could scratch Zeus' beard. He was seven pints deep, but I'll be hornswoggled if he wasn't right. \n \nThe bandit navy protects the Fortress. Ye'll need to meet that navy on the open water. Sink their fleet and destroy the Fortress, and I'll get yer next pint. Three pints even!

It figures. After the mess is made, I have to be the one to clean up.
 
All the fighting has damaged some important Watch Posts along our coast. Could I get you to go there and get all the Watch Posts completely repaired? 
 
I'd go myself, but the last of Thyestes's troops are lurking about and I faint at the sight of blood.
I'm glad one of these men will help your new Capital City.

While we were occupied taking back the throne, Thyestes's elite troops kidnapped some of my Advisors. 
 
Agathon, my survivalist, and General Heron, my best military leader, were taken. They're being held on nearby islands. 
 
Get them back, and I'll give you your choice of which of these brilliant men will join your Capital City.

The harvest season will soon be here, and if we wish to keep the favor of the gods, we must work the soil. 
 
Travel to the nearby fertile valley, farm the land, and build Storehouses to hold the harvest. 
 
Be frugal with Wood, as there are few trees in the valley. And remain vigilant; the rowdy local Villagers may rise up against our rightful rule.

The Chieftains are coming! Run for the hills! 
 
You might be crushing the Followers of Autolycus all over the place, but you've been going up against their rank and file. Their leaders aren't nearly as bone-headed as the mobs they throw into battle. And now they're here! 
 
The brains behind these Followers are three ruthless killers, Chieftains Draco, Clitus, and Homer. I have seen them! If you do not kill all three, we are doomed!
You're a hero!
If you do not kill the Chieftains, we are doomed!
Kill the Bandit Chieftains, Draco, Clitus, and Homer.
Oh, dear! Peepaw wandered into the woods to collect Maple Sap for making real maple syrup. But now it's dark, and he hasn't returned! \n \nCan you find him and guide him home with his sap?
Maple Sap Collected
Peepaw Escorted to House
Challenge: Hope Eternal
Challenge: A Fleet for My People
Challenge: A Fleet for My Cousin's People
Challenge: A Fleet for My Other Cousin's People
Challenge: New-Found Hope
Challenge: Hope Everlasting

King Diomedes wants you to ambush the Sea People army coming this way. Build up defenses and train an attacking force quickly. The king has given you resources to start, and scouts have identified the exact makeup of the army.
Catapults Destroyed
Chieftains Killed
You cannot lose any Town Centers.
Town Centers Must Survive
Found a new colony and advance to Age IV, the Golden Age.
Find the stolen Argos Cows.

The Sea People stole a lot from us when they attacked our shipping lanes--including the Pharaoh's Pet Camel. We need to get her back, or the Pharaoh will want my head! \n \nFind her and return her to your Town Center.

The Sea People stole a lot from us when they attacked our shipping lanes, including the Pharaoh's Luggage! We need to get it back, or the Pharaoh will want my head! \n \nFind that luggage and return it to your Town Center.
Have you found the Pharaoh's Luggage yet?
The Egyptian Admiral wants you to find the Pharaoh's Luggage and bring it back to your Town Center.
The Egyptian Admiral wants you to find the Pharaoh's Pet Camel and bring her back to your Town Center.
Pharaoh's Pet Camel Returned
Pharaoh's Luggage Returned
Destroy the Sea People's Flagship.
Kill the Sea People Chieftains.

We must continue to make these attacks painful for those leading the Sea People. The only way to do this is to kill or convert the Sea People Chieftains. Do this, and then report back to King Diomedes of Argos. \n \nHe would ask himself, but you know how messy things can get with assassinations.
Ah, the captain delivered my request and you have delivered yet again!
Did you take care of that task the captain mentioned?
Sea People Chieftains Killed
Sea People Chieftain Killed
Kill a Sea People Chieftain.

I have a special task for you, straight from King Diomedes of Argos. The only way to break the will of the Sea People is to kill one of their chieftains. Do this, and then report back to King Diomedes. \n \nHe'd ask you himself, but this needs to be kept quiet. Assassinations are sometimes frowned upon.
Ah, the captain delivered my request and you have succeeded! \n \nI do not usually resort to these tactics, but the Sea People are relentless. Your handling of this matter will not be forgotten.

While my home was being destroyed, I saw another fleet engage the Sea People. I learned a little about far-off lands when I was a lad, and I recognized those ships. They were Egyptian. \n \nThe Sea People destroyed the ships and captured their leader, but I can show you where he's being held. I bet you could use an ally right about now...
I told you you'd find the Egyptian Admiral out there! Remember that I helped you out. \n \nI think the Admiral wants a word with you too.
Did you find the Egyptian Admiral? I'm telling you he's out there if you go look!
Rescue the Egyptian Admiral and escort him to your Town Center.
Egyptian Admiral to Town Center
Survive until 30 Refugees have found safety inside the walls of your base.
Those Refugees are dying out there! You need to help them!
Ah, the captain has told me much about you and your heroic deeds aiding our city of Argos! You have saved many lives today! You have my thanks. \n \nCan you help us out once again?

You were right about the Sea People. After you departed, more and more Refugees from the outlying villages streamed in, all telling tales of invaders landing up and down the coast. The Refugees came here for shelter, but they helpfully led the invaders right to us. \n \nHold the frontier base until the Refugees are safe within its walls. Protect them by clearing a safe path for them to your base.
Sea People Defeated
Build Fortresses on the captured islands.
Good work! The Fortresses will secure our coastline against those marauders!

With the Docks in our control, we can again launch ships and recapture any islands lost to the Sea People. Let us show these brigands what happens when they mess with Argos! \n \nRecapture the marked islands by destroying the enemies there and constructing Fortresses in their place.
King Diomedes of Argos would like you to repair the Docks along the coast, and then report to the Argos Captain at the gates.
Those Docks aren't going to repair themselves. Get going!

The Sea People sought to cut us off from any outside help, so they destroyed or occupied any of our Docks they came across. 
 
Their garrisons still hold these. We need to retake and repair them, or we'll have no hope of outside assistance. 
 
If you get them back, you'll be the hero of Argos!
Huts Reclaimed
King Diomedes wants you to recapture the lost villages and their huts from the Sea People forces.
Have you gotten the huts back yet?

The Sea People have raided our coastal villages, and the stream of refugees is getting annoying. If you got those huts back, our city would be most grateful.\n \nBe warned: There's word of naval activity near the coast. Keep an eye out for enemy ships.
Defeat the Sea People with the help of the Egyptian Admiral's troops.

Thank you for rescuing me. I was guarding cargo ships for the Pharaoh, but those Sea People attacked and scattered us to the winds. I have to push them back and retrieve what we lost. \n \nIf you help me get it all back and hurt our enemies, the Pharaoh will reward you handsomely. I'll send some troops along to help you out.
Gather 3000 Food, 3000 Wood, and 3000 Stone for Argos.
Wait until King Diomedes of Argos hears about this haul of resources!
Gather 7500 Wood for Argos.
Gather 5000 Wood for Argos.
Gather 7500 Stone for Argos.
Gather 5000 Stone for Argos.
Gather 7500 Food for Argos.
Gather 5000 Food for Argos.
My ships are ready to haul back any Food you gather.
All your Food arrived safely. That's good eatin'!

After all these attacks, we're going to need a lot of Food to keep the people of Argos from going hungry. Head out and gather a bunch, and I'll make sure it gets back to Argos.\n \nYou may run into resistance, so don't forget to keep defenses up or an army on hand to defend yourself.

We won't go hungry with the stockpiles of Food you're bringing in. Head out and gather a bunch more, and I'll make sure it gets back to Argos.\n \nYou'll run into resistance, so don't forget to keep defenses up or an army on hand.

If Argos is to survive the next attack, we're going to have to construct our buildings out of stronger materials. Head out and gather a bunch of Stone, and I'll make sure it gets back here.\n \nYou may run into some resistance, so don't forget to keep defenses up or an army on hand.
All of the Stone you've gathered will help out a great deal.
My ships are ready to haul back any Stone you gather.

The Sea People's attacks have depleted our Wood supplies. Gather some for the cause.\n \nWood is not scarce, but you can still run into other people who want it as bad as we do. Once you have enough, I'll make sure it all gets back to Argos.
My ships are ready to haul back all the Wood you can gather.
My ships are ready to haul back any Wood you gather.
The Sea People are on the run, but they still have a big navy. We need to cripple it. Go sink their ships. Capture some of the small islands if you need more resources for the fight.
Visit Argos and Talk to the Argos Captain\n
Visit New Troy and Talk to the Magistrate\n
Return to Your Capital City and Talk to the Village Elder\n
Visit the Troy Beach Camp and Talk to Odysseus\n
Visit Mycenae and Talk to King Agamemnon\n
Talk to Agamemnon\n
Defeat all enemies with a co-op partner.
Clear paths through the Followers of Autolycus so the Refugees can reach your Town Center.
The harvest goddess is pleased! \n \nThe Oracle sees all and knows much. A storm is coming, and our people will be at its center. But for now, I have more tasks for you, if you are ready.
Providing a home for the Oracle will bless our people, but the gods have more to ask of you. \n \nNot far from this city is a holy mountain. Travel there and build a Temple at its peak.

This has taken on a life of its own.
 
People came from near and far to see your last farming demonstration. There is only one way to go now. Faster still. 
 
Visit another village and build Farms even faster than before.
Bandit War Leaders Killed
Gearing Up
Bronze Age Technology
Unlock your choice of Bronze Age technologies at the Palace in your Capital City.
Did you unlock any Bronze Age technologies yet?
Unlock a Bronze Age Technology at the Palace
Farm Harm
Nile Denial
Chief Relief!
Sandstorm!
Take the Oasis
Help the Nubian Trader
Help the Nubian Trader\n
Use your Villagers to gather Wood and build a Storehouse. Build Houses and train Villagers to increase your total population.
Build a Barracks to produce an army of Spearmen, and use them to destroy all of the buildings belonging to the Badari.
Visit the city of Massalia and offer to assist the Massalian Trader. He is willing to provide you with blueprints needed for your Capital City, if you agree to help him.
Helping the Generals
Talk to the generals in your Capital City. Help them control the Badari threat to Egypt.
Offer to Assist General Ahapitep\n
Offer to Assist General Batoshipip\n
Help General Ahapitep Control the Desert\n
Help General Batoshipip Control the Nile\n
Cross the open desert, and defeat all enemies at the Oasis Caravan Camp.
Oasis Caravan Camp
Defend the Oasis Caravan Camp from Badari attacks.
Destroy the Guard Towers that are stopping naval traffic along the Nile.
Destroy the Badari Farms along the eastern shores of the Nile.
Speak with Prince Sesostris.
What Are All the Elephants For?
Using the forces provided by General Batoshipip, defend General Ahapitep's Siege Towers and destroy the Badari Stronghold.
House Built
Temple of Ra Built
Kill Crocodiles and Lions, then return to the Nubian Trader for a reward.
Kill Guardians, then return to the Nubian Trader for a reward.
Kill Elephants, then return to the Nubian Trader for a reward.
Have you killed those Crocodiles and Lions yet?
Have you killed those Elephants yet?
Excellent. Those thieves will not steal from the traders any more. But if they do, I know just who to hire.
I can always count on you for a job well done.

Ivory is in demand!
 
Elephants can be found throughout Nubia, and their ivory is in high demand. 
 
The Nubian Trader will offer a fair price for that ivory.
Thieves!\n \nCriminals posing as treasure Guardians are becoming too common. Kill any Guardians you come across and bring back proof to the Nubian Trader for a reward.

Danger!
 
The territories of Nubia are filling with more and more predators. Fortunately, the Nubian Trader is willing to offer a reward for the hides of Crocodiles and Lions. 
 
Kill these beasts and bring proof to him.
The world is always safer with you on the job!
The war effort needs you!\n \nThin the enemy ranks and bring their War Totems to General Chafre.
Have you managed to acquire many War Totems?
Nubian Town Centers Destroyed
Have you destroyed those Town Centers yet?
Collect War Totems from dead Nubian Warriors, Archers, Elephant Riders, and Chiefs. Return to General Chafre for your reward.
Destroy Nubian Town Centers. Return to General Chafre for your reward.
Bring down the Nubians!\n \nRaze their Town Centers and send them away from the lands of Egypt.
I have heard of your work. Take the bounty you have earned.
Master of the Nile
Destroy enemy Fishing Boats.
Ha! You are the truly the Master of the Nile!
Locate the Badari island villages and defeat them.
Destroy the Badari Docks and Fishing Boats.
Visit the Nubian Expedition and offer to assist the Nubian Trader. He is willing to provide you with blueprints needed for your Capital City, if you agree to help him.
Help the Nubian Trader rebuild his village. Build a Temple of Ra, then build Farms and rescue his captured family members with your Transport.
Speak with Prince Sesostris\n
Ambitions of a Prince
Badari Chieftains Killed
The champion returns, and Egypt is glad. They will recover in due time, but your praises will always be on their lips.
Productivity is up 15%! I think you just saved us three hours on the schedule to unify Egypt.
Idleness is productivity lost. Think of all that lost work!
Perfect! Do you see the importance of Storehouses? So many more technologies await!
Please tell me you are not infected with loaf-itis. My scheduling cannot take it.
Ah, is it not grand? I have a few pieces of equipment for you to start you out.
I did give you the blueprint for the Gear Hall, yes? That would be characteristically efficient of me.
Your victory was so astounding that worker efficiency is up! Unfortunately, it is being used to make a parade in your honor, but we will whip that right out of them.
Remove that blot that threatens a unified Egypt!
Locate and escort the Stolen Camels back to the pen by your Town Center.
Wise choices. We will go far with these advancements.
Are you overwhelmed at the choices for Bronze Age technologies?
Nubia is nice this time of year, isn't it? Of course, it cannot compare to the beautiful efficiency of your Capital City.
I just saw two workers sitting on the steps of the Palace. How dare they relax when we have work to do!
Temples Destroyed
May all the gods of providence bless you. It is as though the Badari never attacked! Please take these with my sincere desire that you bring all of Egypt under your command.
Do you wish to bring beauty to your home? Restore mine!
Visit the Nubian Expedition and talk to Prince Sesostris.
Not only have we struck a terrible blow against the Badari, we now have access to a wealth of gold.
If the Badari continue to control the area, I will have to reschedule all of our plans!
Siege Workshops Destroyed
Champion Trireme Destroyed
Trade for Giza Limestone
Good work! Don't trade this Giza Limestone all in one place.
Trade for Delphi Limestone

Not everyone is here to help. Some are drawn by the opportunity presented by conflict, seeking a chance to profit from the misfortune of others. \n \nThere are many armies like your own in the area, some known to be here only to steal. If you sent one home with fewer soldiers and no treasure, you'd earn the gratitude of Sparta.
Sparta is in your debt.
Have you built your own Arena yet?

The battles of strength and cunning need not only take place here in Sparta. You can also construct an Arena in your Capital City. \n \nHere is the blueprint for an Arena. If you build this, you can battle anyone willing to accept your challenge.
Visit Sparta and Talk to the War Commander\n
Sparta!
The City Ambassador would like you to talk to the War Commander in Sparta.
Homer's Elite Guard Killed
Enemy Town Center Destroyed
Kill the Bandit Chieftain Homer and his Elite Guard, and raze his Town Center.
Find and escort the Craftsmen to your Town Center.
Have you rescued the Craftsmen yet?
The Craftsmen are quite thankful.
Craftsmen Rescue
Enough lollygagging! Get those Merchant Carts back!
Find and retrieve the lost Merchant Carts.
Good work! The goods are safe. For now.
Bandits have stolen the latest crafting shipments! Someone has to go out there and recover the Merchant Carts.
Craft Shipment Recovery

I have a gift for you! You can thank me when Egypt is unified.\n \nThis is a blueprint for a Gear Hall. Once you place it in your Capital City, you can outfit your men with production-boosting equipment.

During my bi-daily audit of the Capital City, I learned that sloth is on the rise. Unacceptable! The people claim that working in such a drab and weary city has affected their production. Obviously, we cannot let this stand.\n \nI contacted a trader in Nubia who is willing to provide our much-needed beautification, but we must provide him our aid first. Travel to Nubia and get the trader's help. I will attempt to increase production here the only way I know how.

It is good to see you arrive! I am a trader and little else. I have no skill for leadership or combat, but I know how to bargain for it.
 
You see, the Badari razed my home village, stole the wares I was storing there, and took my family to press into labor.
 
I have the blueprints you need for your Capital City, and you have the skills I need to restore my village. It is a fair trade, right?
Travel to the Greek city of Argos, and speak with the Argos Captain.
Ah, the Sea People. Don't get me started. They are raiding the entire countryside. Refugees are pouring into the city from all the lands around Argos. We could definitely use your help.

We have heard that the Sea People are not attacking only us. They appear to threaten everything along the Mediterranean and Aegean!\n \nYou have been granted passage to the city of Argos, where a large-scale defense is being mounted. Travel there and talk to the Argos Captain at the city gates.
Defend Egypt!

Mycenae is under attack! 
 
The scouts have reported that the enemy is not the Followers of Autolycus, Trojans, or any force we have ever seen before. They are a massive force that came from the sea in many ships. 
 
Protect the Palace. If it falls, we will lose Mycenae to these strangers.
Excellent! I think we gained a bit of time on the schedule.
Do not dawdle. You are wasting not only my time, but the time of both of our generals.
This oasis is wonderful! I was so concerned for my lotus collection out here.
This desert is terrible! I miss the beauty of the papyrus reeds.
The Badari are charging! Man the walls! Defend the lotuses!
My men and my collection thank you. Let us weather this storm and watch the Badari twist in the wind.
Excellent raid! Less food in Badari bellies and more food in ours!
Excellent, the Prince Aha is safe.
Shhhhhhhhhhh! Do not wake the sleeping Prince Aha.
Follow Prince Aha on his "walk" and protect him.
The Sleepwalking Prince Aha

Although Sesostris has left Libya, his brother Aha remains. And even here, far from the heart of Egypt, assassination attempts are a constant threat to members of the royal family.
 
To make matters worse, Prince Aha has a tendency to walk in his sleep. I am very worried about him, but waking him could be disastrous. You will have to defend him while he takes his "walk." 
 
Follow the prince with a small group of bodyguards and make sure he gets back alive. If you're lucky, he might heal your men and fight while he is sleeping. Then again, he might just dance like a chicken and run off into the reeds.
Thank you, good sir. I don't know what Prince Aha would do without you.

Prince Aha continues to sleepwalk around the oasis!
 
You will need to protect him once more if the royal family is to remain safe and sound.
 
With a small group of guards, follow Prince Aha and keep him alive. As before, if you're lucky, he might heal your men and fight while he is sleeping. Then again, he might suddenly wake up and charge into the assassins!
Thank you! I am certain this is the last time you will need to protect the sleepy Prince Aha!
Find and rescue the First Mate.
My First Mate needs to be rescued.
Excellent! I was afraid I'd have to find someone to replace the First Mate.

Overboard!
 
The First Mate of my flagship went overboard in a horrendous storm that sent us off course. He is a strong swimmer and I know the island he was near.
 
Without a doubt, he is being held hostage in a town to the north. I owe it to him to try to arrange a rescue.
 
Will you assist?
Land and build a base on the island of your choice, and then defeat all enemies.

No one is safe where you are about to go. Everyone controls a different island, and they all want to control ALL the islands. \n \nWe do too, and you're the one who can make that happen. The only way to take full control will be to defeat all the enemies. But you'll have some help. They'll fight one another, given a chance. Don't be afraid to allow them to bloody one another without you.
Prince Aha Must Survive
Prince Aha Safe

There are so many pirates around here!
 
First a horrendous storm, now these pirates that are attacking anything that sails near. Come with me, and we will make these waters safe for Egyptian ships.
 
My charts say that there are several islands in the region. The pirates are likely based on one or more of them. We should build a base of our own, and then gouge evil from its shell!

Once again, the Badari have taken control of a river crossing vital to our commerce and supply. If we can defeat their War Leaders, we can retake this crossing ourselves.\n \nGo now and take these War Leaders down!
Those Badari War Leaders still threaten the Nile!
Kill the Badari War Leaders at the river crossing.

You did well with the last bunch of Badari War Leaders. But several must have snuck away and begun training Slingers in key locations along the Nile. \n \nOne of these places has been spotted. Strike quickly!
To keep our control over Upper Egypt, you must destroy those Slinger Training Camps and the War Leaders responsible for creating them.
Let's see, I do all the thinking, and you do all the work. So why are you talking to me? Go fortify the pass!

Oh, it's just you. I was expecting someone... important.
 
Well, perhaps you do possess the skills needed to assist in several of the more menial tasks that fall under my vast jurisdiction.
 
It might be a bit of a stretch for you, but you will need to construct fortifications along the mountain pass. Without defenses, the Nubians will surely return.
 
So, do run along, fortify the pass, and stop the Nubians.
Interesting, you almost did a good job this time. I am... not disappointed.
You seem to be under the impression that the tasks I give you are optional. Go fortify the mesa!
Fortify the mesa and survive the enemy attacks until time runs out.
Protect the Ancient Fort until reinforcements arrive.
The Ancient Fort must be held!
You appear to have not entirely done poorly this time. I thank you.
Ancient Fort Must Survive
Free the Egyptian forces and use them to take control of the Gold fields.
Survive and mine Gold.
The Egyptian Treasury needs Gold!
The Egyptian Treasury grows once more.

In some areas of the Nile, the fishing is great. However, the best area has two problems. One, every enemy we have knows about it. Two, the area is so rocky that farming is useless, and you can't find other animals to hunt.\n \nI need you to go there and get control over that part of the Nile. You should be able to bring back a large quantity of Food if you control the water.
Destroy the Nubian Citadel before you run out of time.
Get five Camels to the end of the gauntlet.
Get three Camels to the end of the gauntlet.
Get at least one Camel to the end of the gauntlet.
How many Pyramids do we have now... six? Nice!
You have been a great boon to my father, the Pharaoh. Let us band together to unify Egypt under our name.
Do not try my patience; you will see it is sorely lacking.
The pass is clear, and these Badari defenses will no longer claim the lives of our people. Let's go!
Do not waste my time nor the efforts of the villagers who built these Siege Towers.
Recapture the War Elephants and destroy the Badari Siege Workshops.
These are fine beasts! They recognized you were their master right away.
We cannot let this opportunity pass us by!
The Badari are no more! Upper and Lower Egypt are one under the divine reign of Narmer!
The unification of Egypt is in your grasp!
It is good to see you again, friend. Let this mark the beginning of our new campaign.
I hope I will see you in Nubia.
These fools will learn the true value of gold when we trample their villages.
Are you not the sneaky sort? That is disappointing.
Cross the Great Divide and defeat the Nubians.
Get a move on. We really need control over that big ditch!
The Nubians march into a trap. Spring it!
Set up defenses and destroy the Nubian army.
Build a Temple of Ra and train 20 Spearmen before time runs out.
Enemies Killed

Alexandria is under attack! Invaders have landed in the Nile Delta and threaten the jewel of the Egyptian empire. 
 
They sent no diplomat, and they come from no foreign empire we know. They greeted us with swords and arrows. Alexandria's navy is in shambles, and we risk losing the whole of the Nile Delta. 
 
Rally the local villages and raze the base camp our foes have created. Defend our empire!
Good work. \n \nEmissaries from the Greek city of Argos have arrived and claim they are also under attack. I think we need to help them and gain an ally against these invaders.
Defend the coastal villages by defeating the invading army.
Hurry! Every second we waste is one less for my father!
Do not delay! This monster must die!
All of Nubia is now controlled by Egypt! Truly you have the blessing of the gods.
First Elephant Camp Captured
Second Elephant Camp Captured
Third Elephant Camp Captured
**<Test Quest>AI TEST Fixed Map**
**<Test Quest>AI TEST Random Map**
**<Test Quest>AI TEST Fixed Map Naval**
Ally Palace Must Survive

The work of a great leader is never done. But what if some of the work could be done for you, by another?
 
What we need is an Advisor Hall. A place where true experts can provide meaningful advice and benefit you in battle.
 
If you build it, they will come!
The Advisor Hall is a fine addition. The very best Advisors are sure to seek invitation in no time.
A Capital City will not simply improve by itself. You must complete the tasks you have been given.

I have come to you because you are the only person I can trust to accomplish my dream: the unification of Egypt.\n \nA nearby outpost has fallen to Badari raiders who have rejected the idea of joining us. Clear them out so our people may grow and become prosperous.

Congratulations! Your very efficient leadership has brought our people into a new Age!
 
Our wise men are bursting with new ideas, and with your guidance, we will unify Egypt faster than I had dreamed of! 
 
Tell our wise men what technologies you wish to have. With that power, there will be no stopping our advance.

This is what I get for trusting a lesser commander... An Egyptian expeditionary force was defeated and captured as they made their way to capture the Gold fields near Napata. \n \nI need you to fix this mess. Go with the Medjay Chief, free the Egyptian army, and then take control of the Gold fields.
Thieves
Glory to the champion of Sparta.
1v1 Unranked Match
Defeat your opponent in an unranked PvP match, one on one.
Glory to the champions of Sparta.
1v1 Ranked Match
2v2 Ranked Match
Visit a Friend

It is about time you helped me out! There is much work to be done, so pick up that oar and get to it! \n \nThe Badari are dropping their filthy nets into my waters and making off with my precious fish! I need you to get out there, sink those ships, and burn their Docks. That'll teach them!
Those Docks aren't going to burn themselves down!
That was a good day's work. Share a fish with me.

Up for more work? The Badari are sneakier than I thought. \n \nWe razed their fishing camp, but there are several small Badari villages on the edges of the Nile. It will take some effort, but root out these towns before they pollute our waters any further.
Nicely done, but the work is not finished. There are more camps to burn.
Shirking your duties? Not on my watch!
Neighborly Defense
The work is never done! There are still Badari villages hidden in the islands, robbing my fish. They will be prepared this time, but I trust in your skills. \n \nFind and destroy any Badari villages.
You earned your keep today, but there will be more villages for tomorrow.

Ready to get your hands dirty? I got just the thing for you. 
 
I see these boats going up and down the Nile all the time. They do not bear our sails, so I can only assume that they are nothing but filthy fish poachers. 
 
If you see any foreign Fishing Boats, send them to the bottom with all their ill-gotten gains. The Nile belongs to us!
You may think that's a lot of Fishing Boats, but I can make twice as many in a week!
Have you caught a fish this big? No? Get to work!
The Renegade Escapade
If you don't help soon, the neighboring city might be destroyed.
A friend has recently visited your Capital City and completed the quest, "Neighborly Defense." Attached is a small reward for you.
Friends Quest Completed!
Visit the Capital City of a Friend\n
I am sure your friends would love a visit.
Reinforcements Arrive in...
Renegades
**<WIP>Shared_Sandbox_12**
Windy's Wild Widgets

Look at how smooth your hands are! Have you put in an honest day's work in your life? 
 
Let's get some calluses on those hands. I know a prime fishing spot, but it has been taken over by the Badari. I want you to get all that good fish that is going to waste. 
 
Fishermen are not the best fighters, so I will send some Triremes to clear out your opposition.
Collect Your Blueprint from Marcus Pollux\n
The Empire Bazaar
Speak with Marcus Pollux\n
Renegade General Killed
The Renegade Escapade Returns

All of Greece knows the crimes of King Thyestes, but still he clings to the crown. To take Mycenae, we must first cripple his famed cavalry.
 
If we destroy the Stables outside the city, they will be unable to train new forces and we can begin our siege. My friend Advising Commander Herculos of Sicyon will provide you with a few highly trained Phalanxes.
 
You will serve as the front-line leader. Use these Phalanxes and your own to hold until Herculos can bring reinforcements. Then you will lead the charge to take out the Stables.

You have used Farms before, right? Think you got the hang of it? Let's get you to work! 
 
There's an outpost that's far from the bounty of the sea. Build that town a series of Farms before the sun sets, and you will have earned your keep today. 
 
Remember Farms require a more advanced town, so you will have to Age Up first.
Farms are pretty nice, right? They're not fish, but they're nice.
No slacking on the job today!
You are not going to destroy any Citadels by just sitting around.
That Citadel isn't going to destroy itself!
Build Fishing Boats to gather Food. Use the Port Master's Triremes to destroy any enemy Fishing Boats you encounter.\n \nAdvanced players can skip this training quest.
Build Fishing Boats to gather Food. Use Advisor Matius' Triremes to destroy any enemy Fishing Boats you encounter.\n \nAdvanced players can skip this training quest.
Advance to Age II, and then build Farms before time runs out.\n \nAdvanced players can skip this training quest.
Show the Badari your might!
Nomad Trader
With the small army provided by General Ahapitep, recover the outpost and clear the desert trading route.

The leaves rustle with fear. There is a sandstorm coming that will cripple any forces caught out in the open.
 
The Badari we ousted from the Oasis Caravan Camp know they are in danger, and they are massing for an attack. They are desperate and will stop at nothing to retake the camp.
 
We cannot let them succeed. My lotus collection would be put to the flame!

We have been tasked with clearing the western trade routes and pushing the Badari out to the open desert.
 
Like a gentle lotus plucked from the fertile banks, the Badari will wither under the scorching sun. To begin, you must sweep away the Badari that have been raiding the local traders. Deal quickly with any Scouts and Guard Towers you encounter, and be sure to recover the abandoned outpost. Without the outpost, you will be unable to replenish your troops.
 
Be careful! If you are ever without troops, you will fail.
The first task is complete! The petals of the Badari horde are already wilting!

Since we are moving away from the bounty of the Nile, we must make fertile ground for future expeditions. The Badari have retreated to an oasis, and its refreshing waters are an ideal place for us to take root.\n \nMake your army the scythe and cut down the weeds!
Combine forces with the Medjay and defeat the Nubian enemies.
It is not enough to build a large military to defeat the Badari. We must also be able to build it quickly. \n\nBuild a Temple of Ra and train Spearmen as quickly as possible.
To defeat the Badari, we must become experts at quickly fielding an army.\n \nBuild a Temple of Ra and train Spearmen as quickly as possible.
Excellent! We've begun to demonstrate we have what it takes to defeat the Badari.
I have a vision of an army rising from the ground so quickly that the Badari can do naught but tremble in their huts. \n \nBuild a Temple of Ra and train Spearmen as quickly as possible.
Excellent! You are a master commander.
You have done very well so far, but can you do it even faster?\n \nBuild a Temple of Ra and train Spearmen as quickly as possible.

We must solidify the prominence of our Capital City.
 
How better than to build a symbol of our power right in the middle of several Badari villages. Expect resistance, as some Badari may revolt against you. But, once you finish, our hold on this area will be secured.
 
I suggest you build some defenses around the construction site. I've given you some extra Stone just in case.
Pyramid Completed
Complete construction of a Pyramid in the heart of the Badari lands.
Complete construction of two Pyramids in the heart of the Badari lands.
Complete construction of three Pyramids in the heart of the Badari lands.
Are the Pyramids complete?
Is the Pyramid complete?
Ah, she's a beautiful Pyramid isn't she?
Large Pyramid Completed
Small Pyramid Completed
Small Pyramids Completed
Aren't Pyramids fun to build?

All right, one last set of Pyramids and we're done... I promise! Complete construction of three more Pyramids among the Badari villages in the area. \n \nExpect more resistance. Unrest among the people is troubling, but these last sites will prove once and for all that we are the new rulers of these lands!

The Badari lands were vast, and one Pyramid isn't enough to awe the locals. Complete construction of two more Pyramids among the Badari villages in this area.\n \nExpect resistance. Unrest grows among the people, but soon they will fall in line.
Excellent work! But we must hurry. There are more Badari threats to fish out of the Nile.
Unless we can clear those Guard Towers, our push to unify Egypt will be dead. Control the Nile and we control Egypt.

The Greeks would call the Badari a hydra. Cut off one head and two grow in its place. Obviously, we must use two generals to cut off both heads! \n \nGenerals Ahapitep and Batoshipip have arrived from their campaigns in Nubia and Libya to do just that. They will guide you to where we must attack the Badari.

While Ahapitep sweeps across the sands of the great desert, we will be like the noble catfish, skimming the Nile waters clean.\n \nThe Badari have a network of Guard Towers along the coast, and their arrows spear through our transports. Take some troops and clear the Guard Towers on the south side of the Nile; then our transports can make it through.

The Badari Farms near the city of Khmun are swollen with food and ready to fill enemy bellies. Like the eel, we must be opportunistic about our next meal, robbing it in the dead of night.\n \nThis opportunity is too good to pass up. Raid their Farms, and we will use their food to strengthen our own armies! Be careful: Even if these are mere Farms, they are assuredly guarded.
Strike, my precious eel! Destroy their Farms!
Destroy the Badari Mystic Temples, and rescue the Chieftains who have been captured.
As hoped, the Nen-Nesu have agreed to our alliance. Let the Badari fear the coming flood of our power.
Swell and flood the Badari outpost, crash down their Mystic Temples, and carry the Chieftains to freedom!

As the mullet band together to better their odds, so must we form an alliance.
 
The Nen-Nesu are a strong and loyal people. If we can earn their respect, they will aid us in the coming battles.
 
To do so, you must rescue their captured Chieftains, and while there, destroy the Mystic Temples the Badari have built in the middle of their most fortified Nile outpost.
 
Such a bold move will earn the respect and loyalty of the Nen-Nesu.
Nen-Nesu Chieftains Rescued
Sesostris Must Survive
Prince Sesostris is young and can be impatient. Have you spoken to him yet?

My son, Prince Sesostris, has been very insistent of late. He is a fine young man, ambitious and hopeful, but he is not the most efficient prince. That will come with age and experience.
 
Sesostris wishes to lead an army to finally defeat the Badari and unify Egypt. His plan has merit, and while doting is not very productive, I cannot help but dote on my eldest son.
 
Help my son as you helped me, and all of Egypt will be ours.

Ahapitep and Batoshipip are good men, but both take their time in battle. The Badari are a blight that must be ripped out quickly and with all the force we can muster.
 
I wish to lead a glorious charge into the heart of the Badari, and I secured the best Camels in the land to do just that. However, the merchants transporting the Camels foolishly let themselves be captured.
 
Join me in securing the Stolen Camels and in slaughtering the Badari in our way.
These Camels should be more than enough to help us reach our next location. Onward!

I apologize for the delay, my friend. Our scouts have reported that the pass ahead is well-defended with Guard Towers. They will surely end our efforts if we advance carelessly.
 
I took the initiative and ordered the locals to construct a small group of Siege Towers. If you provide them ample defense, they will crush every wall and tower as though they were aged papyrus left to fade in the desert sun.
 
Use the Siege Towers and clear the way for our troops to advance!
Use the provided Siege Towers to break through the enemy lines. Destroy all the Guard Towers.

General Ahapitep's march ran into a snag. He left with a force of War Elephants, but they were captured under the cover of a sandstorm. Foolishness!
 
The Badari took the War Elephants to a siege camp. Let us kill two birds with one pachyderm.
 
Take a small force and recapture our War Elephants, then use them to smash the Badari siege camp. Be somewhat careful: We still need enough War Elephants for our attack on the Badari capital.

My father possesses the white and red crowns of Egypt at last. He is sated, but I know we are capable of so much more.
 
If you follow the Nile south, you soon enter Nubia. We frequently trade with the native Medjay, but the other Nubians do not look kindly on us. In light of that, we will use the Medjay to defeat the other Nubians.
 
I know the fires of conquest burn in you. Join me and we will make an empire that will withstand the test of time!
Visit the Nubian Expedition and Talk to Prince Sesostris\n
Visit Libya and Talk to Prince Sesostris\n
Return to Your Capital City and Talk to Prince Sesostris\n
Yes, yes, that seems adequate. But they have stronger Citadels farther downriver.

Yes, it would seem we need an even more impressive demonstration of the Nubian Citadel weaknesses.\n \nAs before, destroy a Nubian Citadel as fast as you can. But this time, do it a little faster, okay?
The Pharaoh is nearly convinced. If you could destroy one more Citadel, it would end the debate.\n \nSpeed is of the essence. Any delay will ruin my expert plan.
Incredible! My idea was a success! And you actually did a good job.
My plan worked flawlessly, again! And as for you, well, I am grateful you did not fail.

Nubia is swollen with Gold, and it is used frivolously in petty baubles. I want to use it to build an army to crush our enemies. A place called the Golden Punch Bowl is nearby and is ripe for the taking.\n \nGo and take control of the Golden Punch Bowl. We can put such wealth to better use in the fight for upper Nubia.
Gather as much Gold as possible, before time runs out.
Sneak through Aswan and meet with the Desert Trader.

I have heard rumors of a man known as the Desert Trader who swears he is vital to our expedition. The problem is he isn't welcome in certain cities leading to lower Nubia. Neither are we, really.
 
He is outside of Aswan now, and the safest way to get to him would be to send three Priests to meet him. 
 
Sneak through the city and reach the Desert Trader. Once he is under our protection, there should be no problem getting out.
I see you secured the Desert Trader. He better pray that he is as useful as he boasts.

The Great Divide blocks our movement south. It is a large ditch with several small bridges across, making it a nightmare to assault. But assault we shall!
 
Several Nubian tribes have banded together to guard the bridges, but that only means more battle and more glory.
 
Build up forces on one side of the Great Divide, and then cross and conquer the other side.

The Nubians have heard of our victories at the Great Divide, and they are sending a massive force to a village in Echo Canyon. What foolishness! Echo Canyon is well-supplied and a defender's dream.\n \nPrepare a defense and slaughter them all. When you pull this off, you open the way for us to take Lower Nubia for Egypt!

I have allies preparing to attack the Nubians, but they are not nearly as useful as you. I need you to be my ace in the hole.
 
I am giving you a small navy with all the materials you need to construct a base. Land out of sight, grow your forces, and devastate our foes with a combined assault.
 
They'll never know what hit them!
Land your forces, build a base, and then defeat all enemies.

Greetings, I'm General Chafre, and I am now overseeing our conquest of Nubia. Our prince likes to do things with his own hands, but he forgets that there is help around every corner. The Medjay are good warriors who know the land and the way of our enemies. Their price is high, and we do not have much time to acquire the funds, but I heard great things about you. \n \nTravel to the nearest Medjay village, gather Gold, and tribute it to them to secure their loyalty.
Travel to the nearest Medjay village and tribute them Gold.

The city of Napata sits near a number of Gold fields, making it a critical location for us and our enemies. Let's put the Medjay to good use.\n \nOur new friends will draw the attention of Napata's defenders while you build up to crush them. Be swift. The Medjay can only do their job for so long, and I would like to minimize their losses.
The City of Napata is beside Gold fields we need to control. Go and secure it for me.

The Nubians, being local, have well-established villages. Sleepy villages make for prime targets.
 
There are a pair of villages supplying the military in the area, and despite their importance, they are barely defended. I want you to raid them under cover of darkness so we can starve our enemies.
 
Get in, kill the Villagers, and get out fast. Guards will rush in if we delay.

The guards we attracted by attacking the smaller villages left two cities wide open. Our window of opportunity is small. We must press on.\n \nThe Medjay will take a while to arrive with reinforcements, but it will be worth it. Build up your forces and then join the Medjay reinforcements to destroy the Nubian Town Centers.
Excellent. The Nubians cannot take much more of this!
Hold on until reinforced, and then destroy both Nubian Town Centers.
Gold Tributed
Fight your way to the pass, destroy the Fortress, and seize control of the Pyramid.
Adventure?
You are invincible! And even the stodgy Vizier will be satisfied with so much treasure. Although, I still have no idea what he wants to do with it...
And the Caravans are away! Let's see if we can do something about the Libyans.
I must have guards for the Caravans.
Get at least one Caravan to the road home.

The Vizier, an aide to the Pharaoh, sent a messenger with a request. The nerve of him, bothering us with his frivolities while we are doing real work! 
 
Gold is difficult to come by here, but we are near a friendly Medjay town. We can send several Caravans to trade for Medjay Gold to get the absurd amount the Vizier wants.
 
Doubtless, Nubians will try to raid our Caravans. At least that will be fun.
Use Caravans to trade with the Medjay Ally to accumulate as much Gold as possible.
That should sate that greedy Vizier for the time being.
Get those Caravans in motion. We need a lot of Gold!

The Libyans are putting up more of a fight than we expected. Since we're encountering resistance, it's time to do something about these pests. I have been thinking about brilliant stratagems we might use to defeat them in a clever manner, but their end result is boring. \n \nYou like elephants, yes? Everyone likes elephants. What do you think about training War Elephants to step on them?
If elephants know how to do anything, it's stomping anything idiotic enough to be underneath.
To win this battle for Libya, we will need those War Elephants.
Train an army of War Elephants before time runs out.

Treachery! An assassin made an attempt on my life while I slept. No one warned him I sleep with one eye open and five daggers in my belt.
 
He still carried his contract and blood money. The Gold came from the Pyramid we ransacked earlier for the Vizier, and this contract bears his mark! I will crush that greedy buffoon's head myself!
 
We must hurry back to Egypt and speak with my father. If the Vizier made an attempt on my life, we can be sure he will do the same to the Pharaoh!
We were too late. My father's body was already cold. We could not save him, but the Vizier will not win this day.
We need the support and blessings of the Priests to ensure that this does not erupt into a civil war.
Fight your way through the town to the Temples to gain their support.
Caravans Move Out in...
Defeat the Vizier's forces.

Vengeance is at hand. Any men loyal to the Vizier must be routed and chased from Egypt, and the Vizier himself cannot leave alive. 
 
The villages near his camp have been swayed by the Priests, and while they cannot help us fight, they will report any movement made by our enemies.
 
Our forces from Libya have not arrived, and we face an entrenched foe. Be careful, be successful, be brutal.

Now this is just silly. You have proven that nothing can stop you in the Great Camel Gauntlet, but no one can get five Camels through in two minutes. It is impossible.\n \nStill, if you manage it, the rewards will be great! I will supply your Camels!
I have never even heard of this happening! The challenge now is to get five Camels through in even less time.\n \nThe rewards will be great! I will supply your Camels!

Now let's really test your skills.
 
Go to the Camel Gauntlet, and try to get five Camels through in even less time.
 
The rewards will be great! I will supply your Camels!

The stakes are even higher at the Camel Gauntlet!
 
You must get five Camels through. Five!
 
The rewards will be great! I will supply your Camels!

The stakes grow higher at the Camel Gauntlet. 
 
You must now get three Camels through.
 
The rewards will be great! I will supply your Camels!

The season is finally here! It is time for the Camel Gauntlet!
 
People arrive from near and far to wager on which Camel will clear the gauntlet fastest. You have the look of a champion. Go and try to get at least one Camel through. The rewards will be great!
 
I will supply your Camels!
So you have arrived in Sparta. Honor and glory are yours if you can prove yourself the best of the best at the Spartan Arena. Are you up for the challenge?
Temples of Set Destroyed
Northwest Village
Northeast Village
Southeast Village
Southwest Village
Defeat the Sea People while defending the Greek Survivor's Town Center.

The bad news is this is a suicide mission for the villages caught in the path of the Sea People rabble. The good news is, if you hold out long enough, it will give us more time to prepare other villages for their arrival.\n \nHold out at all costs and protect any Town Centers for a while. If you succeed, you'll buy us the time we need.
More Cretins on the Coast!
Even More Cretins on the Coast!
More Mercenaries at the Mount!
Even More Mercenaries at the Mount!

Your friend's ally is under attack!\n \nThe invaders have already started the attack, and more are on the way. Can you assist? A defense force has been assembled for you to use. It might be units you have never seen before, but knowing you, that won't be a problem. Clear out the city, and then repel the invading reinforcements.
Defend the ally's Capital City and defeat all invaders.
Your friend will certainly be pleased! In appreciation, accept this reward.\n \nAlso, an extra reward has been sent to your friend on your behalf. It pays well to have you as a friend!
Hail and well met, traveler!\n \nAs a part of your recent purchase, I have a special city blueprint to give you! Be sure to check out my Empire Bazaar. Perhaps you will find something else you need.
More Invaders Arrive in...
You found your way to your friend's city! In appreciation for your visit, please accept this reward.

Visit the Capital City of one of your friends and accept a quest at the City Ambassador. To do so, click a friend's globe in your Friends List, click View Empire, and then select the Capital City you want to visit.
Invaders Cleared from Ally's City\n
Invader Reinforcements Killed\n

I love to travel, and I love making friends. Don't you?
 
Perhaps now is the perfect time for you to visit the Capital City of one of your friends. Go there now and offer to help your friend by going on a quest. You will find the City Ambassador often has something interesting for you to do.
 
Going on quests in this manner will earn rewards for you as well as your friend.

The Lelegan Mercenaries have landed on the northern coast of Crete, and their hungry eyes have targeted my favorite Wonder, the Hubris of Icarus. 
 
 My Scouts have noted a fleet of 10 ships, and they will surely plunder my glory without your aid. 
 
 Those ill-mannered monsters must not destroy the Wonder!
Does the Hubris of Icarus still stand? It does? Splendid!
That Wonder is my favorite! Do not let it fall!
Guerrillas at the Gorge!

Who has two thumbs and places Wonders in the bottom of a gorge? This man! 
 
 The Lelegan Mercenaries have pushed into the Martsalo Gorge and threaten the Wonder within. We count 10 camps of men advancing. 
 
 Please defend my gorgeous Wonder! Get it? Gorge? Wonder? Truly, I am a king among men!
Hm ... what are you here about? A Wonder? Oh, good! I was wondering how that went.

One day, I thought it would be a fantastic idea to build a Wonder on top of a mountain. If it was on a mountain, then all of Greece could see it. It would be my gift to the world! 
 
 Unfortunately, the ill-mannered Lelegan Mercenaries have seen it, and they are sending 10 armies of men to tear it down. You cannot let that happen! 
 
 Go to the White Mountains and defend my Wonder from those monsters!
You look like you just came from the mountains! Oh, you were there? My wonder is safe? Splendid!
Rivals at the River!
What was at the river? And you defended my Wonder? I hope you polished it while you were there!

The Ieropotamos River was nearly perfect: a beautiful body of water that supplies our farms. I perfected it with a Wonder! 
 
 The Lelegan Mercenaries know perfection when they see it, and they seek to destroy my Wonder and plunder it for gold! My Scouts have counted 10 armies. 
 
 Protect the perfection of the Ieropotamos! Defend the Wonder!
Invaders on the Island!

Just to the southwest of Crete is the island of Elafonisi. One day I was taken aback by its beauty, so I commemorated it by building a Wonder! 
 
 Now the natural beauty of the island is being defiled by those dastardly Lelegan Mercenaries. The Scouts have spotted 10 ships nearby. 
 
 Protect my giant metal dedication to the beauty of nature!
Elafonisi was under attack, you say? I sent you out there? I wonder when I did that.

The Lasithi Plateau is a land of rich history! Zeus was born in the caves nearby, and he has blessed the land with abundance. Of course, I built a tribute to the Minotaur there. 
 
 The farmers have noticed strange camps near their fields, and I fear the Lelegan Mercenaries are after the Wonder that rests at the heart of the plateau. 
 
 Take your men and defend the Wonder from the 10 camps of Lelegan Mercenaries.

Mount Kedros may not be the tallest mountain on Crete, but I love it all the same. Why, the other day I gathered a bunch of marigolds to place next to my newest Wonder. 
 
 Imagine my surprise and rage at seeing 10 shoddy Lelegan Mercenary camps near my dear Wonder. This is where you save the day! 
 
 Go to the Wonder at Mount Kedros and defend it from all attackers!
I hope you made those mercenaries pay for every buttercup trampled!
Bandits on the Bridge!
Criminals at Kedros!

Crete is truly blessed by Gaia to have such a beautiful land bridge. I erected a Wonder on the bridge in thanks, and I think it rather pretties up the place. 
 
 The Lelegan Mercenaries have surrounded my dear Wonder and threaten to tear it down to be sold for whatever it is that mercenaries want. They have no appreciation for beauty! 
 
 My men have spotted 10 ships nearby. Go and defend the land bridge!
What was all that commotion? I sent you to defend a Wonder? How intelligent of me! Here is your reward.
Scallywags on the Seas!

One day I was taking a walk across the shallows and found a most wonderful tree. I took a nap under its gracious branches. In dedication to this tree, I had a Wonder erected where it stood. 
 
 Such majesty has not escaped the notice of those blasted Lelegan Mercenaries. They have surrounded the Wonder on all sides with 10 camps of soldiers! 
 
 Take a travel ship and command the defense of the Wonder. It cannot fall!
Thank you for defending the honor of the tree under which I had an excellent nap.

The Lelegan Mercenaries have landed on the northern coast of Crete, and their hungry eyes have targeted my favorite Wonder, the Hubris of Icarus. 
 
 My Scouts have noted a fleet of 20 ships, and they will surely plunder my glory without your aid. 
 
 Those ill-mannered monsters must not destroy the Wonder!

 Now the natural beauty of the island is being defiled by those dastardly Lelegan Mercenaries. The Scouts have spotted 30 ships nearby.
