More Bandits on the Bridge!
Even More Bandits on the Bridge!

Crete is truly blessed by Gaia to have such a beautiful land bridge. I erected a Wonder on the bridge in thanks, and I think it rather pretties up the place. 
 
 The Lelegan Mercenaries have surrounded my dear Wonder and threaten to tear it down to be sold for whatever it is mercenaries want. They have no appreciation for beauty! 
 
 My men have spotted 30 ships nearby. Go and defend the land bridge!

Crete is truly blessed by Gaia to have such a beautiful land bridge. I erected a Wonder on the bridge in thanks, and I think it rather pretties up the place. 
 
 The Lelegan Mercenaries have surrounded my dear Wonder and threaten to tear it down to be sold for whatever it is mercenaries want. They have no appreciation for beauty! 
 
 My men have spotted 20 ships nearby. Go and defend the land bridge!
More Scallywags on the Seas!
Even More Scallywags on the Seas!

One day I was taking a walk across the shallows and found a most wonderful tree. I took a nap under its gracious branches. In dedication to this tree, I had a Wonder erected where it stood. 
 
 Such majesty has not escaped the notice of those blasted Lelegan Mercenaries. They have surrounded the Wonder on all sides with 30 camps of soldiers! 
 
 Take a travel ship and command the defense of the Wonder. It cannot fall!

One day I was taking a walk across the shallows and found a most wonderful tree.I took a nap under its gracious branches. In dedication to this tree, I had a Wonder erected where it stood. 
 
 Such majesty has not escaped the notice of those blasted Lelegan Mercenaries. They have surrounded the Wonder on all sides with 20 camps of soldiers! 
 
 Take a travel ship and command the defense of the Wonder. It cannot fall!
Even More Guerrillas at the Gorge!
Plunderers on the Plateau!
More Plunderers on the Plateau!
Even More Plunderers on the Plateau!
The Elite Meet in Crete
Visit Crete and Talk to King Minos\n
Travel to the island of Crete, and speak with King Minos.

The Wonders of Crete are in danger!
 
A massive invasion has begun on the island of Crete, and the ruler, King Minos, is seeking as much help as possible.
 
If you are willing, travel there now and speak to King Minos.
For many years I have worked to build great Wonders all over the lands of Crete. With your help, they shall be protected from this terrible menace!
The Wonders of Crete are in danger!
The Twelve Kingdoms
Defeat Amathus
Defeat Chytroi
Defeat Idalion
Defeat Kition
Defeat Kourion
Defeat Lapithos
Defeat Ledrai
Defeat Marion
Defeat Paphos
Defeat Salamis
Defeat Soloi
Defeat Tamassos
Recapturing Amathus
Recapturing Chytroi
Recapturing Idalion
Recapturing Kition
Recapturing Kourion
Recapturing Lapithos
Recapturing Ledrai
Recapturing Salamis
Recapturing Tamassos
Uprising!
Bad Dudes 1
Bad Dudes 2
Bad Dudes 3
Enemy Fortresses Destroyed
Bad Dudes 4
Complete this quest to receive a special city blueprint.

I am the Architect, the foundation upon which all of civilization exists. True, not just anyone can be as useful as me, but even someone as low as you can be of use for something. Right?\n \nYes, of course you agree. Now listen well. Along the shores of the lower Nile, the Nubians build Citadels in which they hide between their raids. The Pharaoh wonders if it could be useful for us to learn to build these Citadels. I have superior designs, but a demonstration of the inferiority of the Nubian Citadel is in order. Destroy one, and do it quickly. Show how weak they are to your Egyptian might!
Great job completing Skirmish!
Keep on Skirmishing!
This is a skirmish hall test map.
My Ally 1
Visit Cyprus!
Complete this quest to receive a special Advisor.
The Golden Hippikon
Your empire has surely grown!\n \nIn tribute, the Golden Hippikon Advisor is now yours!
Collect Your Advisor from Marcus Pollux\n
Gold Mine Captured
Stone Mine Captured
Gather Maple Sap and escort Peepaw to the forest's edge.
Superb! With this foothold, you open up the rest of Cyprus to your advantage!
The longer you wait, the more time the enemy has for fortification. Do not waste this chance!
Are you waiting for the mountains to crumble on their own?
Ha! If only Theseus had your might when he challenged the Labyrinth. He would have simply smashed the walls!
The longer Kition stands, the more gold they will gain to use against you!
Kourion had almost every advantage, and you obliterated their defenses. Let all the lands tremble!
Kourion fortifies its gorge as you stand idle.
We have given Marion much time to prepare its defenses. If you wait any longer, it may become too powerful.
Aphrodite's wrath is something to be feared, but do not let it stay your hand.
Excellent! You made it through Soloi's Pass and crushed their defense!
Soloi is training men as we speak to defend against you. Go now!
Tamassos rests at the heart of Cyprus. If you secure it, it will be easy to move west.
Excellent! Tamassos' mines will fuel your rise to power!
Good work. Chytroi is quiet for now.
If we allow the rebels to succeed, all of Cyprus is in jeopardy!
Chytroi Rebels
Idalion Rebels
Good work. Idalion is quiet for now.
Good work. Kition is quiet for now.
Ready to Build Some Farms?
Up for a Bit of Fishing?

The people of Kition have become too bold. After rebuilding their shattered maze of a city, they no longer want to prosper under your rule. This must be stopped immediately! \n \nTravel to Kition and show them that there is no wall that can protect them from your might. Perhaps that will force them to settle down.
Good work. Kourion is quiet for now.
Good work. Marion is quiet for now.
Good work. Paphos is quiet for now.
Good work. Soloi is quiet for now.
Good work. Tamassos is quiet for now.

There is unrest in Tamassos. The Scouts say that a rebellious faction has surfaced, seeking to break from your rule. Worse yet, they have recaptured the mines! \n \nReturn to Tamassos, retake the mines, and eliminate all resistance in the area.

Lower Egypt is beautiful and fertile. The outpost you recently saved should flourish. A well-fed population is a more productive population.\n \nReturn to the outpost and show them the bounty Isis has set before them.

Finally, we have reached the heart of the Badari.
 
Ahapitep is leading the land siege with Siege Towers and the War Elephants we recovered. Batoshipip has secured a base along the Nile and transportation for an invasion force from the Nen-Nesu. You get to be the hero.
 
Ahapitep's Siege Towers can destroy fortifications, but they are defenseless against a mobile army, like the one that has assuredly gathered. Using forces provided by General Batoshipip, defend General Ahapitep's Siege Towers and destroy the Badari Stronghold.
There are many people who do the sort of job I do, and a lot of them are better than me.\n \nIf we build an Advisor Hall, we can recruit those people to help you in your future campaigns.
You are the Lumber Lord!
Defeat the Badari with the help of Advisor Nekhbet's Desert Swordsmen, Axemen, Slingers, and Triremes.

Victory is in our grasp! Herculos' siege and your daring raids have driven Thyestes to lead his army in person. Now that he is out of the safety of Mycenae, I can have justice! 
 
My uncle is not completely unprotected, but I will give you everything at our disposal to end this. 
 
Gouge evil from its shell and make way for Mycenae's true ruler!

The Badari are still refusing my requests to join us in unifying Egypt. Horus help them if they force me to reschedule.
 
The Badari have a village within a few days' march, and if we leave it alone, they will undoubtedly continue interfering with our plans.
 
Prepare an army and burn that village to the ground. For progress! For Egypt!
Somatophylakes Killed

It's clear that the Followers of Autolycus will never leave the people alone. They continue to target our less protected settlements.
 
We think they have a camp nearby. My advice to you is to establish a base, scout the region, discover their camp, and thin their ranks.
 
Advisor Matius from the nearby city of Helice has sent a few specially trained Somatophylakes, Hypaspists, Toxotes, and Triremes to assist you with this task. Mow 'em down!
Defeat the Followers of Autolycus with the help of Advisor Matius' Somatophylax, Hypaspist, Toxotes, and Triremes.
Bountiful Bushes
Ornate Ornaments
Glorious Gardening
Startling Statuary
Hail and well met, traveler!\n \nIn my travels I have come to acquire many fine things--so many, in fact, that I have a few to spare. Please accept this city blueprint as a gift.
Pro Persian Civilization
Celtic Civilization Pack
Egyptian Civilization Pack
Greek Civilization Pack
Collect Your Gifts from Marcus Pollux\n
Hail and well met, traveler!\n \nAs a part of your recent purchase, I have special gifts for you! Be sure to check out my Empire Bazaar. Perhaps you will find something else you need.
Complete this quest to receive several gifts.
Hail and well met, traveler!\n \nKing Minos and the island of Crete await you! Speak to the City Ambassador, and then begin your journey.
Complete this quest, and then speak to the City Ambassador to begin playing The Defense of Crete.
But Wait, There's More!
Unlock Your Booster from Marcus Pollux\n
Hail and well met, traveler!\n \nYou are now the master of battles! The architect of the battlefield! The king of Skirmish! Speak to the City Ambassador, and begin your journey.
The caravans are returning to Kyrenia! I can make a living again!
I am losing gold every day those renegades live!
Defeat the renegades and kill the Renegade General.

Cyprus has many men who have no fear of the law. Those men make it very difficult for men like me to do their jobs. A simple trader is just a walking bag of gold out in the wilds! 
 
A band of renegades have banded under a disgraced General, and they are robbing merchant caravans foolish enough to cross their path. If this continues, Kyrenia will have neither the gold nor the goods it needs to survive. 
 
I will use my funds to supply you with whatever mercenaries I can find. Defeat the renegades!

Cyprus does not have the luxury of a large, unified navy. If you send trade ships out to the open sea, then you are merely throwing gold into the abyss. 
 
The Egyptian port city of Tamiat is rife with pirates, and they prefer Cypriot ships over all others. These pirates keep bases near Cyprus, which is where you come in. 
 
Build a navy and destroy those bases!
It will take time for those dastardly pirates to rebuild. Help yourself to their spoils!
King Minos Needs You!
Even our fishermen dread going out to sea!
Defeat the Tamiat Pirates.
Enemy Town Centers Destroyed
All Enemy Town Centers Destroyed
A Team Town Center Must Survive
Well done! Ledrai will be a fine staging point for further conquests.
How goes your campaign?
Good work. Ledrai is quiet for now.
Impressive! Let us use the bounty of Lapithos to conquer all of Cyprus!
How fares your campaign?
Good work. Lapithos is quiet for now.

I have bad news to report about Lapithos. A prominent copper merchant seeks to make Lapithos independent, and he is using his wealth to hire an army to do just that! 
 
His men have taken over the old defenses and the Fortresses are back and stronger than ever. As long as the Fortresses stand, our supply line is cut. 
 
Please take your army and destroy the rebellion!
How goes the siege against Amathus?
Amathus is yours! Push onward!
Good work. Amathus is quiet for now.

My spies report that all is not well in Amathus. A disgraced leader is using his silver tongue to convince the guards to rise up against your rule. 
 
Letting Amathus declare independence will put all of Cyprus in danger. They will strike out at their neighbors and bring the entire island to war! 
 
Bring your army to Amathus and demolish the Fortresses that stand. Only you can stop this!
The city of Teucer was no match for you! With Salamis under your control, it is time to expand your campaign!
Is the kingdom of Salamis yours?
Good work. Salamis is quiet for now.

A hero is at his most dangerous when he is down but not out, and Salamis is exactly the same. 
 
A band of warriors are crying for independence, and they have retaken the old defenses of the city. If they are left alone, then the people of Chytroi and Kition will be in danger. 
 
Please take your men and destroy those Fortresses!
Cretins on the Coast! (DEMO)
Welcome to Arsinoe and Cyprus. Your task is challenging, but together we shall succeed.
Defense of Arsinoe
My Ally 2
My Ally 3
We cannot let Arsinoe be taken by Salamis!

Tamassos is rich in mines, and it guards them jealously. Take caution. 
 
 The heart of Tamassos' military is on an island in a lake, and it is supported by the villages nearby. These villages also protect the mines in the region. You must secure these mines if you hope to succeed. 
 
Each village guards a bounty of mines. Use them and build a force to crush the Fortresses to the north.
With Paphos taken, we have all but secured our sovereignty in Cyprus.

Amathus is well-known for its vast fields of grain and gentle sheep. The kingdom is dense and the people flourish under the blessing of Aphrodite. 
 
Do not let that fool you into thinking Amathus is an easy target. The city knows how to survive a siege. 
 
I know you have the cunning and might to make Amathus yours. Demolish the Fortresses and Amathus will bow!

Powerful Kourion was founded by the men of Argos. I am sure you know their power. 
 
Not only do you face a strong foe, but you face one that has chosen an advantageous position. In order to reach the heart of Kourion, you must traverse a gorge lined with archers, towers, and catapults. 
 
Use the expansiveness of the coast to your advantage, and build an army that fears not the arrow!

Lapithos prospers with sweet water, fertile ground, and mighty smelting furnaces. Its people know luxury, and its armies are well-supplied. 
 
Lapithos will serve your armies well, but it will not be taken easily. It will be a straight fight, and the nearby villages will band together to repel you. 
 
Use their land against them and shatter their Fortresses!

The kingdom of Salamis was founded by Teucer, a peerless archer from the Trojan War. It marks the first step of your campaign. 
 
Your camp is situated near enemy defenses, so please be careful moving forward. If you can find your way through or around the defenses, then I am sure Salamis will crumble. 
 
This is where it all begins. Defeat Salamis!
Excellent work. Speak with me again soon. I expect a letter from Philadelphos of Arsinoe, the city leader.

I received a letter from Philadelphos of Arsinoe. They are very thankful for the defense of the town, but this will not stop Salamis from trying again. 
 
Philadelphos says he has a plan to prevent future attacks and increase the power of our empire. It sounds like an offer we cannot refuse! 
 
Travel to Arsinoe and speak with Philadelphos. He will tell you his plan.
Travel to Cyprus and speak with Philadelphos of Arsinoe.

The kingdom of Kition is the work of the Mycenaeans. It is a rich port town, and the landlocked kingdoms go through Kition to sell their goods. \n \nOur target rests on a peninsula, accessible by small shallows on each side. Find a way to the peninsula and obliterate the Fortresses there. Let neither man nor god stop you!
General Killed
Cyprus Generals Killed

Many people are happy that Cyprus has been unified under your empire! Their lives are peaceful, and they can focus on their homes and families without fear. 
 
Unfortunately, not everyone prospers under peace. The Cypriot military is bored, and that makes for an easy target. Rebellious factions are securing the aid of Generals and becoming more dangerous than ever. 
 
These Generals have lost their way and will not return. Punish them!
Have you found any more Generals?
Thank you. We move ever closer to peace.
Kingdoms Defeated
Destroy the Fortresses and recapture Amathus.
Destroy the Fortresses and recapture Kourion.
Destroy the Fortresses and recapture Kition.
Destroy the Fortresses and recapture Lapithos.
Destroy the Fortresses and recapture Salamis.

Ledrai may seem quiet, but it is anything but quiet. A group of rabble-rousing Generals have gathered anyone who would listen to them, and they have rebuilt the ruined defenses of the land. \n \nAs long as those rebels control the Fortresses, your control of Cyprus is in jeopardy. Rally your army and retake Ledrai!
Destroy the Fortresses and kill the Generals to recapture Ledrai.
Recapture the mines and destroy the Fortresses to recapture Tamassos.

The people of Soloi take you for a fool. They assume that since they are so difficult to reach, you will never know of the rebellion growing in the city. 
 
They have rebuilt their defenses against the terms of surrender and selected a General from amongst their ranks. It is an open challenge to your authority! 
 
Even though the journey will be rough, go to Soloi and put down the rebellion!
Destroy the Fortresses and kill the General to recapture Soloi.
Destroy the Fortresses and kill the Generals to recapture Marion.

Ledrai may not be as populated as Paphos or Salamis, but it is just as important to take. We must secure the kingdom before they have the opportunity to call for reinforcements. 
 
Ledrai's primary defenses rest along a drying riverbed. Much of the land is barren except for whatever remains on the banks of the river. 
 
You will be forced into conflict early. Destroy the Fortresses and kill the Generals to take Ledrai!
Great Marion kneels! Rest tonight and celebrate your victory! Cyprus is yours!

Soloi will be a test of your mettle. If you can pass its test, then I know that all of Cyprus can be yours. 
 
You see, the kingdom rests in an area that is difficult to reach. It enjoys an open field that is accessible only through a treacherous mountain pass. Soloi will flood that pass with soldiers that seek your ruin. 
 
Make it through the pass and prepare yourself for open battle. But beware the General: he will do his best to stop you.

The Argives of Kourion did not take their defeat well. After you smashed their Fortresses and armies, these rebels chose to rebuild both to spite you. \n \nIf you wish to maintain control of Cyprus, then there is no other choice but to put this rebellion down. Go to Kourion and quell the rebellion!

Marion is a prosperous kingdom, and there are always people who wish to see it bow to no one. They have pooled their money to hire powerful mercenaries, ruthless Generals, and master masons. The Fortresses are rebuilt, and Marion is under their control. \n \nThis situation must be undone as soon as possible, and only your might can make it so. Travel to Marion, decimate their mercenaries, and demolish their Fortresses!
Break through the enemy defenses and destroy their Fortresses to capture the kingdom of Salamis.
Capture the kingdom of Soloi by crossing the mountain pass to destroy the Fortresses and kill the General.
Destroy the Fortresses and kill the Generals to capture the kingdom of Ledrai.
Destroy the Fortresses to capture the kingdom of Lapithos.
Destroy the Fortresses to capture the kingdom of Kourion.
Destroy the Fortresses to capture the kingdom of Amathus.
Capture the Gold and Stone Mines, and then destroy the Fortresses to capture the kingdom of Tamassos.
Cross the shallows and destroy the Fortresses to capture the kingdom of Kition.
Destroy the Fortresses and kill the Generals to capture the kingdom of Marion. Defeat Marion to control all of Cyprus!

The island of Cyprus is a land of great beauty and wealth. Currently, it is controlled by twelve kingdoms that do little more than bicker and battle each other.
 
The city of Arsinoe has been a safe port for our people, but the city-state of Salamis has amassed an army at its walls. We cannot leave our ally to the swords of its enemies. 
 
Take an army aboard transports and depart for Arsinoe immediately. The city must not fall!
Land your army on shore, build a Town Center, and quickly move to defend the city of Arsinoe.
Kill Cyprus Generals.
How goes the conquest of the Twelve Kingdoms ?
Defeat the Twelve Kingdoms of Cyprus.
The Twelve Kingdoms bow to you. Cyprus and all of its treasures belong to your mighty empire!
Visit Cyprus and talk to Philadelphos of Arsinoe\n
Generals Killed
Amathus Rebels
Kition Rebels
Kourion Rebels
Lapithos Rebels
Ledrai Rebels
Marion Rebels
Paphos Rebels
Salamis Rebels
Soloi Rebels
Tamassos Rebels
Amathus Defenders
Chytroi Defenders
Idalion Defenders
Kition Defenders
Kourion Defenders
Lapithos Defenders
Ledrai Defenders
Marion Defenders
Paphos Defenders
Salamis Defenders
Soloi Defenders
Tamassos Defenders
Salamis Invaders
Trireme Trim Time
Is trimming the Triremes proving too time consuming?
Ha! Those Triremes sure got their sails clipped!
Elite Triremes Destroyed
Destroy Elite Triremes.
Guardian Hippikons Killed

After the Trojan War, Cyprus was flooded with Greek immigrants, led by Chytros. In order to make Cyprus your own, you must conquer the home of its founder. 
 
The land is well settled, and the men know of your arrival. A company of powerful Hippikons blocks your way to the Fortresses. Beware the smaller villages, for they will surely mount a defense. 
 
Destroy the Fortresses, and Chytroi will have no choice but to bow to you!
Defeat the company of Hippikons, and then destroy the Fortresses to capture the kingdom of Chytroi.

A local band of rebel Hippikons has riled up the people of Chytroi. We must quell this insurgence before it threatens all of your holdings. 
 
You must defeat the Hippikons in order to reach the Fortresses they also hold. 
 
Destroy the Fortresses to end the rebellion!
Defeat the company of Hippikons, and then destroy the Fortresses to recapture Chytroi.

This is the final battle, my friend! 
 
Marion is the last of the kingdoms, and it has seen what has happened to its sisters. Marion is rich in copper, gold, and wood, and it knows that a great and powerful army comes for it. It will use everything in its power to halt your advance. 
 
Marion will strike ceaselessly and its Generals will show no mercy. You must break through the wave and crush it without hesitation!

It is a marvel!
 
Your lowly eyes might fail to detect the majesty of its construction, but trust my superior understanding when I tell you: This is a treasure of an Ancient Fort.
 
But if it were to fall into enemy hands, it would quickly become a deadly threat to our control of the region.
 
This time you must do your very best. Protect the Ancient Fort until reinforcements arrive.

For as far back as you can imagine, Egypt has been populated with the finest of skilled craftsmen. Your patronage will be critical to upholding these traditions.\n \nTo begin, you must first build a Crafting Hall. After that, you can select the Crafting Schools our people should focus on. Once you have selected your school, you can begin to create custom gear and items for the troops, or to trade to neighboring cities for Coin.

The Vizier has requested that I lead an expedition to Libya. It is strange that he asks for money then sends me away from where we are already doing so well.\n \nThe Medjay will continue our work. For now, I must heed this buffoon whom my father holds dear. Meet me in Libya, and we will see what challenges await us.
Accumulate 5000 Food using only fishing.

It turns out getting treasure out of a Pyramid takes a lot of work! Caravans have been called to haul it all away, and they're being loaded as we speak.\n \nIt is very likely the Caravans will come under threat once they are fully loaded. You must protect them from anyone who is foolish enough to get in our way.
A bit sub-par, but you did manage to at least finish the job. I, of course, take the lion's share of the credit. After all, the Nubians never expected my engineering genius!

It would seem I must again stoop low and allow you to assist me.
 
You can, of course, thank me for this honor at any time.
 
As for the next task, we must begin construction on the nearby mesa. You will be outnumbered by the Nubian tribes in the area, so do all of that military stuff that prevents the enemy from getting through, and try not to fail.
Kill as many Villagers as possible before time runs out.

I fear this might never end, Prince Aha continues to sleepwalk around the oasis!
 
Unfortunately, Sesostris has recalled most of the guards to assist in his latest military campaign, so you will need to make do with an even smaller group of guards.
 
As before, follow Prince Aha and keep him alive.
The Badari have stolen the latest crafting shipments! Someone has to go out there and recover the Merchant Carts.
The Vizier is dead, my father is avenged, and Egypt is together as one. You are the one to thank for all of this. One hundred parades in your honor!

We have cleared the way to the Nubian heartland, and final victory is close. One last push, and they will bow down to our glorious Pharaoh.\n \nAgain, the Medjay will need time to build up their forces, so you will be their shield until then. When both of you are ready, smash through and burn all to the ground!
Ra, Set, Ptah! I demand all these Priests entreat Horus in this hour.
They may come back, but I know you will save us again.
We can't get a single ship out to sea!

A renowned General has abandoned his post to make some quick gold. As if these bandits were not bad enough! 
 
This General leads his men with precision and guile, and his raids are driving me into debt. It will take an extraordinary army and a pile of gold to defeat him. 
 
I have hired a band of mercenaries to help you. Please save my business!
I can't survive while these renegades are stealing my shipments!
My shipments! My gold! Thank you!
Tamiat Pirates

The Tamiat Pirates are back and more powerful than ever! They're sinking every ship in the water. 
 
We rallied a fleet of Triremes to scuttle their base, but they were destroyed as they were anchored in the dock. If we can destroy their base, then we will be safe again. 
 
Please raise a navy and fight those pirates!
Destroy the Enemy Town Center
Priestess to Queen's Temple One

There is an Ancient Temple Complex in the mountains nearby. The Priestesses say that sanctifying the place will earn us the blessings we need to defeat our enemies, but a pack of wild dogs has taken residence. The Priestesses are not warriors, so it falls to us to do the dirty work.\n \nBe warned: The Medjay village nearby is not under our control.
Get those Priestesses to the temple complex and watch your back.
Train Priestesses and escort them to the Ancient Temple Complex.
Nubian Trader's Family

You are doing well, but this is going to get more difficult. Are you ready?
 
Your farming demonstrations are getting a lot of attention! More and more of your people are following suit and starting their own Farms. Your show has worked twice now, so let's see if you can get even more people farming by providing an even greater spectacle. 
 
Visit another village and build Farms even faster.

Troy is ours now, but that pesky Paris has been secretly trying to amass champions to lead a new army. He has offered treasure to any elite soldier willing to join his ranks.\n\nHunt down any elite soldiers you come across to make sure Paris' plans never get off the ground.
Destroy the Fortresses and kill the Generals to capture the kingdom of Paphos.
Destroy the Fortresses to capture the kingdom of Idalion.

As you forge farther west, you will find far less friendly terrain. The mountains are as strong a defense as any wall, and you will surely encounter both. 
 
Idalion is prized for its copper, and flourishing trade has earned them much wealth. 
 
Their defenses are rumored to be as confounding as the Labyrinth on Crete. They mean to use this network of walls to slow your men and expose them to the arrows of their Fortresses. 
 
Crush their walls and bombard their Fortresses!
The western kingdoms have no chance against your might.

Paphos is a sacred land. It is the birthplace of Aphrodite, founded by the son of Pygmalion and his statue-wife, Galatea. The home of the goddess is blessed, and its defenders will fight tooth and nail to ensure that we do not mar its beauty. 
 
In order to defend their assets, they have built a mighty Fortress near their mines and have positioned their most powerful Generals in the vicinity. 
 
Because the mountains are not hospitable for crops, they have large fields in the valley below. Use all your guile to destroy the Fortresses and kill the Generals. Paphos' treasure will be yours!
Destroy the Fortresses to recapture Idalion.
Destroy the Fortresses and kill the Generals to recapture the kingdom of Paphos.

The people of Idalion no longer want to share its profits. If Idalion is left to its own devices, it will attack the other Cypriot kingdoms and foster a revolt. For the good of all of Cyprus, you must destroy their fortification. \n \nTravel to Idalion quickly, ascend the mountain, and tear down their Fortresses!

There is a veneer of calm in Paphos, but something dangerous lurks below the surface. I consulted the oracle of Aphrodite, and she warned me that a rebellious faction sought her wisdom only a few days ago! 
 
The rebels have gone to the countryside, terrorized the villagers into aiding their cause, and rebuilt the Fortresses that you razed. They have hired Renegade Generals to lead their revolt!
 
Go to Paphos and bring ill fortune to these rebels!
Die Gloriously
Escort the Wood Caravan to Safety
[PH]
Visit the city of Massalia\n
Barbarian War Leaders Killed
Transports Arrived
Excellent! You have found a bounty of food and a new ally.
Help the Massalian Trader\n
Our hero returns!
Food for the Winter
Build Order
Have you visited my cousin's tribe?
The streets are clean again! Be sure to check for gear in the stores you encounter while visiting other players and regions.
Grinding Gears
Beat the Barbarians!
Cradle of Civilization
Look at them run like rabbits! The tribes will flock to your might.
These are all wonderful choices.
Have you chosen your Bronze Age technologies?
Massalia
My wife told me that you rescued everyone and the village is better than ever! I will never forget your kindness. Here, take your reward!
Seeing the World
Help the Massalian Trader
Poke, Prod, and Smash!
Tell me, what civilization do you know that has survived without an Advisor Hall?
Let's show them the might of the Celts!
Is that a carp? It's huge! I think I need a moment alone with it.
I can taste that delicious fishy taste even now.
Those Farms will survive the test of time.
I tried to eat a pumpkin once. It did not taste as good as a carp.
Eyes of the Enemy
Locate and destroy the Barbarian Watch Towers.
Those Watch Towers are an eyesore.
Special Launch Offer
Season Pass I
Uniting the Tribes
These alliances are just what we need to be recognized by the other civilizations!
Well done! Sometimes the best offense is a good defense.
A warrior never hesitates!
Defend the allied Town Center and defeat the Barbarians.
Be the Shield
We own the pass and Villagers are building the base as we speak. It is time to destroy the Fortress.
Clear the Pass
The Fortress must burn!
I just saw the Druids slinking away from my sight. You have more work to do.
If those Druids die, our negotiations are over.
Rescue the Druids from the Barbarians.
Drust's Druids
Working Overtime
Marauders

You have done good work today. I believe we are now ready to finalize our alliance. \n \nReturn to your Capital City and tell your Tribal Chief that we are now brothers, and we will now work together to make the Celtic civilization a mighty and shining jewel in the world.
Return to your Capital City and speak with the Tribal Chief.
The Long Walk Home
Visit Massalia
Welcome to Massalia, the haven of civilization in Celtica!
Brennos Beckons!
Meet Protis in Massalia.
Meet Brennos in Tylis.
That Fortress burned brighter than any fire I have seen. You are my kin, and the Senones side with you.
Destroy the Fortress with the help of Brennos' Longbowmen.
Burn the Sacred Groves to the ground!
Destroy the Sacred Groves with the aid of Drust's Gaesatae.
Trial By Fire
Defend Brennos and the Senones from Drust and his Gaesatae.
Treachery!
The Fate of All Traitors
War Academies Destroyed
We must bring order to Celtica!
Defeat Drust and his Gaesatae in order to capture Vindelicia.
Wanted: Wolves
Thank you! You made the world just a bit safer.
A Wolf ate my mother last week.
Dangerous Wolves are injuring Villagers and pose a threat throughout Celtica. \n \nThe Senones will reward anyone who brings proof of killing these beasts.
Super Epic Bear Hunt
One time, I played tug-of-war with a Bear over a fish.

Those look delicious! Thank you for the work.
Wonderful!
It's beautiful. The Druids will be here soon to bless it.
It is wise to heed the gods.
Build a Wonder at the designated location.
Barbarians have stolen the latest crafting shipments! Someone has to go out there and recover the Merchant Carts.
Followers of Gaumata
Trade for Celtic Charcoal
Thank you for bringing order and civility back to Massalia.
Massalia is a bastion of order in our world. It cannot fall!

Skirmish Hall Land Test
Brennos Must Survive
Grecian Town
You understand the basics of trade. I think we can do business.
Feeling Grovey
Wow, I guess you people really like those sacred tree things!
I'm sure Gyptis told me what those things are called before.
As promised, here is the reward that was sent. Nice doing business with you.
I hear your Druids sacrifice people. Is that true?
Use a limited force to construct Guard Towers in the allied villages.

You're pretty good at building in a pinch! I bet your Villagers can knock the most hardened Hypaspist out for hours. 
 
Some smaller Celtic tribes are being bothered by the Oxubii, and they asked Massalia for help. Normally, I would send a merchant there to arrange a price, but the Oxubii would cut his head off before he could even say hello. 
 
Go to the villages, build some Guard Towers, and defend them against Oxubii. In return, you can take whatever reward is given, minus a finder's fee.

Gyptis found another gray hair this morning. This can't go on any longer! 
 
The Oxubii homeland is guarded by three outposts. Each outpost supports a Fortress, and those Fortresses are your target. 
 
You will be under pressure the moment you arrive, but I believe in you, your warriors' huge muscles, and your scary, animal-sacrificing people! Obliterate those Fortresses!
You did it! The way to the Oxubii is clear! What's that, Gyptis?
Your ponies are so tiny!
Destroy the Oxubii Fortresses.
Two If By Sea
The people of Lattes are eternally grateful. Come, let's end this.
Please forgive Protis. His ignorance of our people befuddles even me.
Persia in Peril (DEMO)
Gaumata's Gambit
Under Pressure
Gate of All Nations
Rebellion Leader
Wandering Marauders
Gaumata's Lieutenant Killed
Gaumata Killed
Gaumata's Elite Killed
Gaumata still lives!
Victorious! With the defeat of Gaumata, I am sure the rebellious spirit amongst the people will surely be quelled.
Merchant Carts are very important. Without them, merchants have to carry stuff in their hands, or drag things. This is serious stuff. Help out or its going to be bad!
Ha! I knew I could count on you. Tomorrow we will have a city-wide parade of all the carts you rescued. It will be huge!

Have you seen the Merchant Carts?
 
They keep getting stolen, like clockwork, every single day. It's as if someone has made it their quest to steal the carts, hide them near some dangerous enemy camp, and then wait for someone like you to come along and bring them back, in a big, fancy demonstration of heroics.
 
Well, any chance you can help out?
Objective: Oxubii

It would seem the Followers of Gaumata continue to rally despite his death and your continuous victories. A demonstration of wonder is in order!
 
Travel to the outlands, find the most treacherous collection of enemy camps, and build the Gate of All Nations in the middle of the lot.
 
You will know the exact spot to put the Wonder when you get there.
Weren't you going to do something about those Followers of Gaumata?
Build a Wonder at the designated location before time runs out.
With each Wonder, we improve upon our legacy of virtue.
Survive and reach a total population of 200 before time runs out.

You remind me of a story from my childhood.
 
Long ago, there was a heroic war captain of Persia. Then he stopped doing what his empire needed him to do. The people revolted, and then there was a new war captain. The end.
 
Perhaps there is a lesson you could learn?
With our great numbers, no force will stand long in our way!

Our lands are under threat!
 
Wandering Marauders have set up camps in the nearby valley. It's unclear what they want and even less clear the lands from which they hail. I call upon you to travel out, locate the enemy, and prepare a large force of our people to show our strength.
 
If they engage you in battle, be sure to defend yourself. You must impress them with your defenses and ability to marshal a large army while under pressure.
Every man has his price.
Thank you for all of your efforts in keeping the peace in Massalia. Please accept this with my eternal gratitude.
Fortress Fury
Their priests can beg as many gods as they like for aid.
The wealth of this temple is greater than anything I could have imagined! We are kings of the world!
Thracians are always a good fight!
River City Rampage
Block Buster
The Athenians will not bother us again, but I have bad news: the bridges across the Spercheios are destroyed.
This reminds me of a boar hunt I went on just before this campaign.
Blowing Forts Away
Build a Bridge and Get Over It
I wonder if we should burn the bridges after crossing.
The Town Centers were as bright as any beacon. The Aetolians are scrambling even now.
As long as the Aetolians are reinforcing Thermopylae, Brennos is in danger!
Distraction Action

Your sneak attack worked swimmingly. The Aetolians ran like rabbits when they saw their homes burning. 
 
We must take advantage of this opportunity before they return. Thermopylae heavily favors the defender, so even without the Aetolian reinforcements, this will not be easy. 
 
The time for trickery is done. Show the Greeks that not even nature can save them from our might!
Defeat the Greeks at Thermopylae.
The Sack of Delphi
Sea Dock Burn
Popping Up
We need those soldiers!

The army marching to Delphi needs our support! The army has suffered casualties, and without speedy reinforcement, our campaign will fail. \n \nWe must build an army in Tylis as quickly as possible. Any trained soldier, ship, or civilian will do.
You finished just in the nick of time. I will order these men to Delphi immediately.
The Heat of the Night

Those twice-cursed Barbarians have committed the greatest offense I know! You must exact my vengeance! 
 
I spotted their filthy nets sullying the pristine and sacred waters of the Rhone. Worst of all, they took fish from my secret fishing spot! 
 
Sinking their Fishing Boats is not enough. I want their Docks to burn for months!
Day one of Docks burning: check.
Flippy and Little Shiny, your deaths at the hands of the Barbarians will be avenged.
Destroy the Barbarian Docks.
Sink or Swim

It looks like the Barbarians are starting to work together in order to keep you out of their business. Why don't you show them how useless that is? 
 
The fishermen noticed a large Barbarian fleet on its way to our ally's Docks. If those Docks go down, that will leave our pals cut off and easy prey. 
 
We have a few small encampments nearby. Use whatever you can to sink that fleet!
Stand firm, fearless leader!
Protect the ally's Docks from attack.
Well done! No doubt they'll try again, but let's have a fish feast tonight!
Public Relations Nightmare
The Greeks are happy! Another success for CACAO!
CACAO needs you to give people lots of resources!
Tribute resources to various Greek allies.
I have never seen an attack that brutal!
Threading the Thracian Needle
Phase one is complete. This is where it gets tricky.
I cannot ensure Tylis can stand on its own any longer.
Guide the Caravan to the abandoned Town Center.
Thracian Thrashing
Die Hard or Die Hard
They'll be feeling that one in the morning. Let's take the opportunity to expand before they recover.
Those Thracians don't know who they're dealing with.
Defeat the Thracians.
At least those men rest as heroes.
I know this mission is not easy, but it is for the sake of all of our people.
Poor Nanna. She confused a wolf for my uncle.
That looks so beautiful! I'm just going to take a couple for myself.
The fires are burning, and the chefs are waiting for the fish!
Quickly gather fish.
Look at all of those shining scales. I have to eat one now!
You saved the day and my stomach!

The Tribal Chief will not stop demanding these feasts! The Barbarians are still sinking my best ships, and it will take a miracle to get the fish on time. 
 
You have to help me! She keeps asking for the impossible, and I don't know what to do. 
 
Do not let the Barbarians slow you down. Fish like my life depends on it!
Darius will be most pleased with your successes! You are truly an ally of Persia.
Meet the Persians
Persian

Using the Persian forces provided by the Tarsos Trader, destroy the War Academies and Town Centers controlled by the Followers of Gaumata, and kill their leader, Gaumata's Lieutenant.\n \nEnjoy this quest as a sample of what's available in the Pro Persian Civilization. For the full Persian experience, visit the Empire Bazaar and purchase the pack.

Messengers from the Village of Sens and Vindelicia arrived just moments ago. Both tribes want to negotiate alliances with us. The more united the Celts are, the better! \n \nYou will need to earn the trust of Brennos of the Senones and Drust of the Vindelicians. Go to their villages and help them as they would help us. Once you have their favor, we can finalize our alliances and build a powerful empire.
Visit Vindelicia to speak with Drust and visit the Village of Sens to speak with Brennos. Earn their respect and favor so that your empire may grow.

Hail and welcome to the Village of Sens! Before I can accept an alliance, I wish to see your prowess on the battlefield. 
 
You have shown you are strong with the sword when you destroyed the Watch Towers earlier. I now wish to see you be the shield. 
 
Barbarians have settled by one of our outposts, and they are preparing to attack. Protect that outpost and defeat the Barbarians!
Ally Town Center Must Survive
You must defend the Village of Sens!
I am relieved to see that the Village of Sens still stands. Drust will pay for his lies!

Drust had you gather Gold so he could hire an army of Gaesatae, and then he used them to attack the Village of Sens. I do not know why he would do such a thing, but he is a traitor to the Celts. 
 
The Senones are safe for the time being. In order to ensure the safety of Celtica, we must take the battle to Drust in Vindelicia. 
 
Be careful. Drust is sure to be surrounded by the best of his Gaesatae. Capture Vindelicia and save Celtica!
My cousin loves what you have done, and he wishes to ally with us.
If I find out who left their blade just outside my home, I will run them through with it.
The trader confused you with Barbarians? What an idiot.
There! Let's see the Greeks try to confuse us now!
Persia needs you! Do not allow Gaumata to gain control of the empire.

Look at all these weapons littering our streets. If anyone thinks this is how civilized people live, I will give them a black eye. \n \nHere is a blueprint for a Gear Hall. Once this is placed in your Capital City, you can equip your warriors with armor and weapons. Also, it will get all of this trash off the ground.

It is good to see you. With your leadership, we will unite the tribes and become a civilization that is the envy of the world! 
 
We are mighty, and we must use that might to protect those who cannot protect themselves. A nearby tribe is currently under assault by Barbarians. 
 
Those uncultured brutes will destroy everything if left alone. Go and slaughter them all!
Excellent work. I will send word to Brennos.
The Gaesatae performed wonderfully. Return to your village for now. I will send word later.

The Barbarians are monsters, raiding and pillaging as they please with no concern for the consequences. Our neighbors are victimized daily! 
 
One tribe lost all of their food when the Barbarians struck. There is no way they can survive the winter on their own. 
 
Go visit the tribe and hunt down every scrap of food in the area. Leave no beast alive!
The tribe will starve without your help!

It is up to us to save the tribes and make our civilization shine like a jewel. As long as the Barbarians live, they will oppose us at every turn. 
 
I tried to give them every opportunity to seek civilization and become good citizens, but there is just no saving them. If they only understand force, then give them force! 
 
Raise an army and obliterate their encampment. For civilization!

The outpost is finished and the initial troops have arrived. This will be a true test of your skill. 
 
We Celts are better suited fighting man-to-man rather than man-to-Fortress. You must learn how to defeat it, or else your enemies will always take advantage of your weakness. 
 
I will provide some Longbowmen to help with any defenders. Purge the Barbarians. Burn the Fortress!

Our people are recognized by civilizations throughout the world, but they fear we are anarchistic marauders. One man is willing to give us a chance to prove our worth. 
 
You remember the port town of Massalia, correct? Their leader, Protis, is asking for our help in keeping the peace. 
 
Helping him will restore order and secure a powerful trade ally. Remember to punch out anyone who opposes law and order.
Something terrible has happened!
Thank goodness you've returned!
Visit Massalia and Talk to Protis\n
Visit Tylis and Talk to Brennos\n
Oxubii Town Center Destroyed
Town Center Defended
Village Hall Must Survive
Siege Engines Commissioned

Perhaps you have heard of Gaumata the Usurper?
 
He is the nastiest, most devious, and most untrustworthy of all men! How many has he tricked into believing that he is the son of Cyrus? How often has he sparked rally cries of rebellion? He is bold, dangerous, and mean. He has escaped justice until now. He has foolishly gambled that we would not catch him as he passed by the fortress of Sikayauvati.
 
Be swift! Seek out Gaumata and his followers, and defeat them with your superior skills and wisdom.

Since the death of Cyrus the Great, the struggle for leadership has brought much trouble to Persia! On one side, there is a man claiming to be Bardiya, son of Cyrus, and on the other side is Darius, a great hero of our people. I am but a humble trader and would normally not involve myself in the affairs of our leaders, but this man claiming to be Bardiya is an imposter! I know him to be Gaumata, a most cruel warlord.\n \nHis followers have set up camps nearby to train Magi at their War Academies. Use the loyal Persian forces I have mustered to destroy them if you can. Help Persia through this time of great trouble.
Defeat Gaumata the Usurper and his Elite Guard.

Quickly build eight warships and a Merchant Transport before the Sea People destroy your ally's village.
Build Fishing Boats to gather Food. Use the Port Master's Swanships to destroy any enemy Fishing Boats you encounter.\n \nAdvanced players can skip this training quest.
Acichorios' Trireme Must Survive
Comontorios Must Survive

Good day! I am King Agamemnon's treasurer, Mogoadius.
 
Thanks to you, we have our city back, but there are still many problems.
 
Some of the traitorous scum who followed Thyestes have taken refuge in the hills near Mycenae's Gold Deposits. Might I convince you to travel there and protect our miners from those bandits? While you're in the area, if you could collect enough Gold to refill the city's treasury, it would give me something to be treasurer of again.

It is time to sever the head of the Badari snake. Those villains have taken a series of Gold Deposits that I had calculated into our plans for unifying Egypt. As long as the Badari mine that Gold, they not only delay us, but they also become a far more dangerous enemy. To get back on schedule, we must eliminate the camps and their leaders.\n \nAdvisor Nekhbet of Nubia has provided a few elite Desert Swordsmen, Axemen, Slingers, and Triremes to aid our cause. Beat down all opposition!
Mycenaean Treasurer Mogoadius wants you to travel to the hills where the city's Gold Deposits are located and gather Gold.

The Vizier, for just an aide to the Pharaoh, seems to always need more gold. At least this gold comes with a little adventure.
 
I have a map to a mysterious Pyramid filled to the brim with treasure. That is what the Vizier wants. Said Pyramid is guarded by a Fortress, and terrible guards determined to provide a great challenge. That is what I want!
 
Let us take this Pyramid and send the Gold to the Vizier. He gets what he wants, and we get adventure!
Escort the packed-up camp.
Take That, Tamiat Pirates!
Take That and That, Tamiat Pirates!
The surviving Priestesses are quite satisfied. Their blessings will rain javelins and stones upon our enemies!

King Narmer is dead, betrayed by the Vizier. That jackal knew I would survive his trick, so he fled, protecting himself with men loyal to him.\n \nBefore I can challenge him in the open, I will need the support of the Priests from each of the Temples. For that, I need your help. We must visit all three Temples, and do so carefully. The Vizier's agents are sure to be looking for us.
Good work - for a beginner. I could fish up eight times that in half the time, but I will beat that work ethic into you.

Twelve Kingdoms squabble amongst themselves and throw smaller towns like my own into turmoil. 
 
I ask you to unite these kingdoms under your flag. Under one empire, their fighting will cease, and all people on Cyprus will live peacefully. Consider what Cyprus has to offer you--gleaming copper, verdant forests, fertile farmland, and a connection to mysterious lands far away!
 
Rally your armies and ride out. Force the Twelve Kingdoms to kneel!
Write this down: "The enemy will never expect you to be where you are least expected."
Crush these settlements, see them driven before you, and hear the lamentations of their goats.
The Prescription is Conscription
Fresh Celtic troops will take too long to reach us. We must use the Greek forces against them.
Captured Thracian Village
Challenge: Fast and Furious Fish Feast
Challenge: Furious Fish Feast
Challenge: Fast Fish Feast
Totally Boaring
Alpine Adventures
Tower Defense

Complete this quest, and then speak to the City Ambassador to gain access to your new Skirmish Booster Pack.

Travel to the island of Cyprus, and speak with the Skirmish Commander.

Why hasn't Odysseus been defeated yet?
Isn't it better to battle alongside friends?
There are still battlegrounds left to conquer!
Did you find a favorite battleground?
Why hasn't King Narmer been defeated yet?
Why hasn't the Village Elder been defeated yet?

Mastery is a lifelong endeavor. Be sure to come back for more training.
Defeat all enemy units in a Skirmish match.\n \nAll units and ages up to the selected maximum age will be unlocked when playing this quest.
Why hasn't Darius been defeated yet?
Is this particular victory condition giving you trouble?
Glory to the victor!
Why hasn't King Minos been defeated yet?
Why hasn't General Batoshipip been defeated yet?
Why hasn't General Ahapitep been defeated yet?

Using a limited number of troops, get Brennos through the mountain pass.
Brennos Through the Pass
Sacred Groves Found
Brennos Must Survive
Train Druids in order to heal the Villagers at the Vindelicia Mining Camp.

This Barbarian infestation is worse than I thought. Scouts have revealed that they are constructing a Fortress to block access to our allies. We must reach the Fortress and tear it down with our hands! 
 
We must clear the mountain pass to set up camp and secure a supply line, but the pass is guarded by Barbarians. Fortunately, we have an ally outpost in the pass. 
 
I will go with you to ensure the aid of that outpost. Once we have their help, build an army and clear the pass!
Caravan Culling

The injustices perpetuated by these Barbarians never end. Drust of Vindelicia sent word that he is missing Gold shipments from one of his many mines. 
 
Drust was not polite in asking for our help, but for the sake of justice we must aid him. How can we be the jewel of civilization if we do not help others? 
 
I am certain the Barbarians are behind this. Crush their Caravans to halt their pillaging.
I will send word that the Barbarians are no longer stealing his Gold. You have more work to do!
It is odd that Vindelicia does not have the warriors to recover their own Gold.
Destroy the Barbarian Caravans.
Find treasures and kill Guardians.
Kill Wolves.
Kill Bears.
Kill Boars.
One day, I stared down a wild Boar for three hours.
The Clash at Thermopylae
Winter Survival
The Augur's Flight: Auggie's Appearance
The Augur's Flight: Auggie's Advance
The Augur's Flight: Auggie's Accomplishment
After many hours of climbing, Auggie reached a camp where he could spend the night. He was far from done with his travels.

Being an explorer, I see and hear many things in my travels. Out of all of my stories, one stands out before all others. 
 
Even though the Celts sacked Rome, not every member of that army made it back home. The Augur Augustus was a captive of Rome for many years, until one day the gods opened his cage and let him escape. 
 
The only way home was across the Alps. Auggie would have to fight the harsh winter and all the dangers of the mountains.
Guard Tower at Marker 2
Guard Tower at Marker 1
Guard Tower at Marker 3
Auggie did well to find an ally in the brothers.
Auggie had conquered the Alps, and he finally returned home. He and his allies were hailed as heroes and given places of honor.
Lead Auggie's party to the village.
That's a good start, but there are always more criminals to be found.
The Greek forces are waning. Now is the time to strike!
Visit the Village of Sens\n
Watch Towers Found
Do not allow the Barbarians to settle in our lands!
Barbarians in Massalia! Ring the alarm! Oh, wait--it's you.
The fates of Massalia, Celtica, and your empire hinge on this moment.
This Advisor Hall is one more step toward becoming a flourishing civilization.

You do not have to be alone when in the chaos of battle. There are many skillful men and women who will give you their knowledge. \n \nHere is the blueprint for an Advisor Hall. Once this is built in your Capital City, you may invite Advisors to aid you in your future campaigns.

I see them beneath the surface, just out of reach. Carp! I love their shimmering scales and glassy eyes. Every lake and river is teeming with these delicious fish. 
 
I really want one for dinner, but those brutish Barbarians have taken over the area. 
 
Build Docks and Fishing Boats to gather the fish, and I will send some Swanships to clear out the Barbarians.

They may not have fish, but Farms are still a precious gift from nature. There is a town that is running out of berries and deer, and some Farms would be of help. 
 
If you can build the Farms, then they will eat like kings until the end of the world. 
 
Remember that Farms require a more advanced town, so you will have to Age Up first.

Welcome to Vindelicia! Now get to work. 
 
The Barbarians you drove from your land have decided to run amok through my Sacred Groves, and the Druids there were foolish enough to be captured. I told the Barbarians that I would pay their ransom, but that is just a clever ruse. 
 
Go in my stead and recover my idiot Druids.
You can kiss this alliance goodbye if those Villagers waste any more time.
It is good to see you again. With you by my side, we cannot fail.

Gratitude is in order. Due to your efforts, I acquired enough Gold to obtain a more permanent solution to ... the Barbarians. 
 
As a reward, I will allow you to use a small company of my newly hired Gaesatae for your last task. There is no need to thank me for this magnanimous gift. 
 
The Barbarians defiled my Sacred Groves beyond all redemption. Defeat the Barbarians and cleanse the Sacred Groves with fire.
Look at all these pelts. This meat will feed people for weeks! Good work.

Our craftsmen were inspired in their dreams by Lugus, and they yearn to build a fantastic structure in his name. If it has been demanded by the god, then we must oblige. \n \nThere is a site that would be perfect for a Wonder, but the land is not uninhabited. Remove all defenders if you must, and then construct the Wonder.
Food, Stone, Wood--it is all Gold in the end.
Build Sacred Groves in the Vocontii villages. Join forces with the Vocontii to defeat the Oxubii.

You would not believe the number of people who confuse brave and noble Celts with crass and craven Barbarians. One night, I interrupted my ballad to give a three-hour lecture about the vast differences between the two people. 
 
The Celts for the Advancement of Cultural Agreeable Opinions was formed to promote favorable opinions of our people. CACAO is a leader in Greco-Celtic relations, especially in Massalia. 
 
Of course, we promote good relations with massive bribes. Would you be willing to help?

We need a fish feast tonight, but the Scout reported that Barbarians are infesting the waters. Can you lend a hand? \n \nThe feast is just a few hours away, and we need a huge pile of fish in order to make everyone happy. I know it's last minute, but I believe in you!

The Tribal Chief has organized another fish feast and tasked me with getting the fish. The problem is that those Barbarians are still prowling the waters! \n \nThe fires are already lit, and we're down to the last moments before the feast begins. I'll pay you whatever you like. Please help me get the fish!
Help the Massalian Trader rebuild his village. Build Houses and upgrade the Town Center to Age II. Then build Farms and rescue his captured family members with your Transport.

A messenger from the Village of Sens arrived moments ago saying they're under attack! The Vindelicians somehow hired a massive army led by Gaesatae and are using it to destroy the Senones. 
 
Brennos rallied a defense, but even he cannot survive this without aid. We cannot let Drust win. 
 
Take whatever forces we have and go to the Village of Sens. Save the Senones!
Build a Market and use it to generate the Gold you will need for an army, and then defeat the enemy base.

Congratulations! Your strong and orderly leadership has brought the Celtic tribes into a new Age! 
 
We can now research technologies that were once beyond our ken. 
 
Tell our men what technologies you wish to have, and they will do all that is in their power to make it so. Technology opens the way to power!

Your Capital City is austere. Perhaps Spartan? I refuse to have our beautiful civilization compared to the Spartans. \n \nI contracted a merchant in Massalia, the Greek city to the south. He is willing to provide us with decorations for free, but we must help him with some trouble. Travel to Massalia and aid the merchant.
Massalia is a symbol of the unity of the Greeks and Celts. They are two great civilizations that go great together.

Help! Help! Barbarians are--hold on. 
 
Forgive me, but you look very similar to the people who have taken my home and family. The Barbarians came in the middle of the night and set all I knew ablaze. I barely escaped, but those monsters have taken my friends and family to their camp across the river. 
 
Please, use your might to save my village and rebuild what was lost. I will give you all that I have!
How were the homes of the Senones and Vindelicians? I'm sure ours are far better.
Defenders of Filippopili

As you well know, Vindelicia is swollen with Gold. Villagers work day and night to ensure the prosperity of all of our people. 
 
The Barbarians you chased from the Sacred Groves tried to raid our Gold Deposits. They failed, of course, but many of the Villagers were injured in the conflict. 
 
Instead of wasting days waiting for the Villagers to heal, train a force of Druids to heal them. Beat the Villagers if they get out of line. Or if you just feel like it.

Congratulations! You are truly a force to be reckoned with.
Are you getting cold feet? Perhaps you should practice against fewer opponents first.
When taking on large armies, a group of friends can prove invaluable. Bring three of your friends along for a truly epic battle and prove to me that you can win as a team.
It's too quiet around here. Why isn't a large battle raging?
Do you have what it takes to conquer the world? Prove to me that you can emerge victorious on all the battlegrounds in Skirmish.

Great job beating your opponents! Think you can do it again?
I get tired of all the bragging around here. Someone needs to put these heroes in their place. Will it be you?
Mastery of Skirmish comes with practice. Defeating the first group of opponents will prove your worthiness for future challenges.
This is just the first milestone on the path to mastering Skirmish. More opponents await!

The word around the hall is that you haven't defeated all of your foes yet. The question is: why not?
The final milestone to mastering Skirmish involves defeating a seemingly endless number of foes. Will you emerge as the king of Skirmish?
You have completed the last of the Skirmish milestones, but there are always more enemies to conquer. Keep fighting!
Conquering each of your foes will require you to counter their tactics. Odysseus commands a well-balanced army. Defeat this hero by yourself to prove your superiority.
It seems that the tales of heroes are often exaggerated. What will your story be?
Conquering each of your foes will require you to counter their tactics. King Narmer prefers cavalry and big, bold soldiers. Defeat this hero by yourself to prove your superiority.
Conquering each of your foes will require you to counter their tactics. The Village Elder prefers a strong defense and a well-guarded base. Defeat this hero by yourself to prove your superiority.

Conquering each of your foes will require you to counter their tactics. General Batoshipip prefers a strong navy when appropriate but otherwise commands a balanced army. Defeat this hero by yourself to prove your superiority.
Conquering each of your foes will require you to counter their tactics. King Agamemnon prefers to hit hard and fast with infantry. Defeat this hero by yourself to prove your superiority.

Tribute Gold to the Greek village to obtain Ballistae and Palintonons. Use these siege engines to defeat the Oxubii.

Thank you for repelling the Oxubii from Lattes. In order to stop these attacks, we must deal a crushing blow to the Oxubii homeland. 
 
I sent a messenger to a Greek village skilled in constructing siege engines. They are willing to lend their powerful Ballistae and Palintonons to our cause, but they are demanding Gold before they do anything. 
 
Give the Greeks their tribute, and then use their powerful siege to crush the Oxubii!
Army of Comontorios
Delphi
The craftsmen have been paid and work is beginning. How exciting!
I hear they are bringing the greatest craftsmen for this festival!

The craftsmen are nearly finished with the preparations. Thanks to your efforts, this will be the best ceremony of all time! 
 
There is one last thing we need: the feast! The Oxubii have driven off any Food in the area, and we are almost out of time. 
 
Do everything in your power to obtain the Food we need. Do not let the Oxubii slow you down!
We will be truly blessed this year! Please take this with all of our gratitude.

Auggie and the brothers took refuge at the peak of the mountain pass. When Auggie looked down, he could see the flickering lights of his village. Soon, he would be home. 
 
At the camp, a proud Longbowman lay wounded. Auggie treated the injuries, and the grateful archer gave his aid in descending the mountain. 
 
The bandits did everything in their power to stop the four from leaving alive, but nothing could stop Auggie from reaching home.

Now that we have our men, let's shore up our naval support. I know just the place to get some ships. 
 
Filippopili rests on the Evros, and powerful Ballista Triremes are moored at their Docks. If we destroy the Docks, then we can commandeer the Ballista Triremes. 
 
Comontorios will go with you. Take those ships and level the city before they can mount a counterattack!
Join Comontorios and destroy the Docks to take the Ballista Triremes. Use them to defeat the enemy.
Join Acichorios and defeat the enemy. Then escort the Merchant Transports through the Evros.
Use Auggie the Augur to convert Villagers in order to gather Wood. Afterward, escort the Merchant Caravan to safety.
Join Comontorios and destroy the Aetolian Town Centers to draw the enemy away from Thermopylae.
That village could not survive without Auggie's aid.
Auggie and his party made it to the village in time. The mountain was alight with celebratory fires.

Hail and well met, traveler!\n \nI see you have been helping fellow traders. In my travels I have come to acquire many fine things--so many, in fact, that I have a few to spare. Please accept this city blueprint as a gift.

I thank you again for your help with my problem. All the traders will hear of you and your good deeds.
 
Speaking of traders, it would be good for you to visit with Marcus Pollux when you return to your Capital City. He often rewards those who are kind to traders, and he is well known for his own selection of fine goods.
 
Look for him when you return. He should have set up an Empire Bazaar somewhere near your Palace.

Giza Limestone can be pretty hard to come by around here. If you would like some, you will need to do a little bit of work first.
 
The only local source is at the end of a Marauder-infested river. To get there, you will need to sneak, smash, and rush through numerous enemy obstacles and traps. To get some help along the way, supply Food to each of the ally Trade Docks. They might be able to lend you a boost of speed or some extra boats along your route.
 
Be quick to act and quick to think; the Marauders are known to constantly change their obstacles and traps. Good luck.

Be quick to act and quick to think; the Marauders are known to constantly change their obstacles and traps. Good luck.

I have traveled the world and seen many civilizations in peace and in war. I come to your empire with a challenge. 
 
A nearby village boasts that they have the greatest warriors and tacticians. They are so confident of their victory that they will give you a small mercenary force to use against them. 
 
Use your forces wisely and crush the opposition!
I suppose it is easy to raise and command an army when you are a warrior culture.
Defeat the enemy.
It's All About the Gold
Build a Barracks to produce an army of Spearmen. Use the army to destroy all of the buildings that belong to the Barbarians.

Enemy Docks Destroyed
Ballista Triremes Secured
Help Comontorios make his way to the captured Celtic allies. Rescue them and defeat the Athenian army. Don't wake up the sleeping guards!

While scouting, Comontorios spotted a small Athenian army camped just on the other side of the Spercheios. I sent our finest swimmers to cross the river and take out that army before they could raise the alarm, but they appear to have all been captured. \n \nHelp Comontorios rescue the captured Celts and destroy the Athenian army.
We are swimming in men and ships! Speak to Acichorios for the next part of the plan.
Now that we made it through the Evros, we can march south! Find out what Brennos has planned next.
Brennos to the Temple of Delphi
